description: I'm giving this dive bar 5 stars because they have some of the cheapest drinks in the area and the bartenders are super friendly. This is definitely a great place to start your night before you bar hop in the area.
author: Alexander G.

description:
Went in yesterday for drinks post work.   The bartender was beyond rude.   Ask for two shots of Jamo and she poured the shots into tiny shot glasses instead of the normal cup of Jamo.   People right next to us who had just finished their shot were given a cup.   Beyond the bartender shorting us on the shot, she was incredibly stand offish.  No thank you or any kind of kind gesture which a bartender should do.  Lady decided she didnt like our group before words were even said.  Frankly, the bar needs to address this.  Left immediately after the shot issue.  It was incredible how blatant this treatment was.  Lady deserves to be fired for treating customers like dirt.

Update: bar owner knows exactly what I mean when I mention the cup shot vs tiny glass shot.   Instead of apologizing for poor service he denies he's ever heard of shots being served in cups.    Not only is the service terrible, but they have no intention of trying to improve.   Do yourself a favor and go anywhere, but this dump.   Chestnut has a lot better to offer.
author: Justin S.

description: I only go here because it is close to my house, its deff a hole in the wall  beer mens club sort of vibe but I dont mind it. They are always playing sports and seem to have a lively crowd most nights. Worth checkiong out if you are in the Marina and wanta reliable beer joint.
author: Ellie J.

description: Locals just kinda tolerate you drinks are small and weak. Marina bar one block over poured a really good drink for the same price much friendly people.
author: David G.

description:
This is an Old School Bar that is a pretty basic watering hole to grab drinks, watch sports and play pool.  This place goes back to 1934 - One of the Post-Prohibition Bars.  It is one of the best low key bars on Chestnut Street in the the Marina District.  Given the neighborhood, this is a pretty unpretentious spot to grab a beer or two when you're in this neck of the woods.  This is a drinkers bar.  I am by no means a regular, but I can tell that there is a high regular presence.

They have a nice pool area in the back with two tables.  It sorta reminds my of Gino and Carlo.  I usually just catch a Giants game or some Football.  I have recently fallen in LOVE with the NBA and I just noticed they are a Celtics Bar, which is my adopted Eastern Conference team.  I may propose that they institute a $2 discount if you wear Celtics gear.  (Just bought a Jae Crowder jersey shirt on Clearance since he's now a Cavalier)  So, they got that going for them, which is nice.

$7 for a Beer is too much.  It's also The Marina, so at busy times it can lurch towards Marina-ee pretty quick.  But, given that statement, this bar gets voted least likely to go Full Marina Obnoxious and feels the most San Francisco of the spots in this area.
author: Adam S.

description: Came here after having lunch at the Dorian.  Cool little dive bar.  Ordered our standard Jameson and ginger ales and played a ton of pool.  I like how they have 2 tables in the back 0.75 to play.  Cool place to hang out to pre game.  Bartender was really nice and attentive.
author: KB B.

description:
4.5 STARS

After happy hour / dinner nearby, my girlfriend and I wanted to keep the drinks flowing. After yelping bars in the area, I found Horseshoe Tavern. We stopped by on Tuesday, June 21st around 8:15pm.

What drew us to Horseshoe? Why, their Yelp check in special of 100% off our first drink! It applies to all their well liquor, so we ended up getting two shots of Jim beam. I had originally asked if Jameson qualified, but sadly, it didn't. The roommate is a pickier drinker than I, so he paid for a Glenfiddich 12. We, of course, tipped on all three drinks.

Fun bar. Remember to take advantage of their Yelp check in deal!
author: Elena N.

description:
Great dive bar in the city. Location is excellent amongst lots of restaurants.

Full bar, really chill down to earth bartenders. Seems like they make make just about any drinks. They also have a SICK Yelp! check in offer - first drink free!

Two pool tables
Bathrooms are clean enough
One golf arcade game
Some really cool old school san francisco photos on the wall
Crowd is a big mix! Some bikers, so hipsters, some brunchers, and a couple east bayers (us).
author: Drew P.

description:
My kind of bar. Dark, zero tourists and nothing fancy. I appreciate the craft cocktails and wood fired pizza of the Marina but sometimes you just want to be left alone with a very strong G&T. 

This is exactly the place for that. Fun fact, I used to visit Cory (the bartender here) 10+ years ago nightly post my cocktail waitress shifts in Jackson Square. Cory is the perfect bartender. Fast, friendly and just enough small talk without being weird. 

I came here on a Friday afternoon and was happy with my drink, the unpretentious crowd and mostly my long lost favorite bartender, Cory!
author: Alison C.

description:
I love this place, and I just don't go often enough. The Horseshoe Tavern has been here it seems for forever; I used to go meet my girlfriend there to watch the Chargers on any given sunday in the mid 90s, so that is at least 20 years.

It's a great neighborhood dive bar, great tap selection, and they can make pretty much any cocktail you want. I even asked for a Negroni, and it was perfect.

The Marina is touristy, but not many tourists wander off to walk up and down Chestnut, so if you're visiting, you will get to rub elbows with San Franciscans.
author: Massimo M.

description: I saw the bartender just last night use extreme racism to two men of Indian decent. Starting with me noticing them being served well drinks for premium liquor prices. Then telling them they don't belong there. Goin as far as almost threatening violence. As a marina native it made me disgusted by what I thought was a decent bar. I would encourage anyone who reads this to take your business elsewhere. RACIST BARTENDER!!!
author: Jackson M.

description:
Went in to Horseshoe this evening for some drinks and to shoot pool with friends. We welcomed the low-key atmosphere and the reasonably priced drinks after an evening out on the town and were looking forward to relaxing as we wound down our night. 

I closed out my tab after a few drinks as we finished our game of pool, thinking we would leave after that game. After my group decided to stay for another game, I went up to the bar to buy another beer and was told by the bartender (didn't catch his name) that it was "annoying" that I had already closed a tab and was back to buy another drink. 

I understand the concept of opening tabs and get that it's slightly inconvenient that I came back to use my card at the bar for a drink after closing out - but I was taken aback at his reaction considering that I had tipped accordingly on my previous transaction. That bartender needs a lesson on the basics of customer service.

In short - great location, cool atmosphere, reasonably priced/stiff drinks, but the service could use an upgrade. If you're looking for a different atmosphere while out in the Marina, this is a solid location for a slightly different flavor.
author: Steven W.

description: Neighborhood dive bar. I like real. This is no fluff, no BS. Nice option for the Marina.
author: Amy O.

description: What a GREAT dive bar to visit when in SF . Nothing upscale here but has 4 star service thanks to the great bartenders at the horseshoe tavern . I had Corey one evening while visiting and Brooke for my next visit and both made the experience so worthwhile. Very accommodating and super friendly . The fresh squeezed IPA is a great choice if you enjoy IPAs the flavor is unique but great tasting not too hoppy as well . thumbs up for the Horseshoe tavern
author: Greg L.

description: Super chill spot with pool table and Golden Tee. Decent beer selection. Friendly bartender.
author: Celena P.

description: My husband and I came here for some drinks after a long day of sight seeing. After seeing the good reviews on yelp, we came in. Great prices, great atmosphere and friendly staff. We used the last of our quarters on the parking meters so the bartender just gave us some to play pool with. Not sure if he was the owner but he was super friendly. Only complaint I have is the women's bathroom toilet was off the hinges and very wobbly.
author: Riley M.

description: Love this local bar and this is our favorite spot; best bartenders in the Marina, great drinks and bartenders treat you like family! If you have not stopped into this place, you need to as you will not be disappointed; best place in the Marina and the bartenders are like no other-we would not go anywhere else!! Love the Shoe!! Best place to watch sports and remember to always be kind to your bartenders! #bestmarinabar
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great place, awesome vibe, even funner bartender! Noe made us one of his specials... so delicious!
author: Tania M.

description: The Horseshoe Tavern should be considered a historical landmark. I've been coming here for years, great vibe, AMAZING bartenders and a warm welcome every time you step through the door! The  pricing for drinks is incredibly fair considering the surrounding bars and restaurants that are being forced to charge higher price points do to the economic changes in SF. I would recommend the Horseshoe to anyone that is in the Marina area!
author: Brandy R.

description:
I came here with my lady.  Gary the bar tender is fantastic.  I saw a guy come in that was completely in tears and he ordered a shot of jäger and Gary the bartender covered it for him.  Way to help a guy up when he is down Gary! 

5 stars all the way!!!
author: Cory F.

description: 4 stars for being established 1934, and qualifying as a true dive bar. Nothing fancy here.  Just a good juke box, cheap beers for SF, and Boston Ed Sox memorabilia. 2 pool tables. $5 domestic drafts, $7 crafts on tap.
author: Bob B.

description: Jackass Ericthe door guy who needs a real job is an asshole- his friend tanner decided to be an even bigger dick and cause more issues
author: J A.

description:
Coming here after the Giants game on a Monday night, we were just looking for a night cap and Horseshoe Tavern was the place to do this. It's a laid back bar where you can just belly up and enjoy some brews. The bar was about half full for most of the night with most patrons seeming to be locals.

There's about 15 beers on tap with two pool tables and digital jukebox for your enjoyment. Pray that a lightning bolt doesn't strike while you're in the bathroom though, because you'll be standing in a pool of water. Corey was the bartender and he took care of us all the way until last call. We appreciate that he was hanging with some of the regulars at the other end of the bar, but still had time to intermittently check on us and even talk some sports.

With reasonably priced drinks, good service, and a relaxed atmosphere, Horseshoe Tavern is a great place to unwind and tip a few back.
author: Arthur M.

description:
Horseshoe is a fun local spot if you're looking for a dive-y bar. I felt like it deserved an extra star given the location--I like the Marina but it does lack casual hangout places. Location is good so it does get crowded sometimes, but not nearly as bad as the other watering holes in the neighborhood. The last time I was here (Saturday evening before dinner), Tacolicious across the street was already a madhouse but my friend and I were able to grab seats at the bar at Horseshoe. There are TVs at the bar and pool tables in the back. Bathrooms are gross, no surprise.
 
Drink options are pretty standard and prices are reasonable. Yelp tip: Check in and you get a free draft/well drink :)
author: Connie Q.

description:
NBA Finals Game 6! What a great day! 

I was looking for a spot to just hang out and watch the third quarter by myself while waiting for the bf to finish signing some contracts with his customer. I normally am not a fan of the Marina crowd, but the free drink offer for checking in on Yelp drew me into this humble bar. 

Huge flatscreens everywhere and several good beers on tap were all I needed and Horseshoe delivered. It was pretty crowded so I didn't want to bother the bartender with the free drink. He was a nice guy and spotted my 5'5" self behind some 6 ft. tall Marina dudes. $7 for a Sierra Nevada. 

Can't say I'll be back anytime soon, but Horseshoe definitely left me with a positive impression. :)
author: Bonnie S.

description: What is up with this Boston Bar crap?!?  I'm a Giants season ticket owner and a regular. Should I go somewhere else for road games?  I like the place and the staff here is excellent.
author: Philip D.

description: Favorite Marina Bar!   Brook is the best!
author: Tim Q.

description: This bar has terrible services and prices they are hostile towards customers and not at all friendly.  If you are looking for a good time go somewhere else.
author: Ben W.

description: This was our first stop on our one night bar hopping San Francisco adventure and I have to say, I wish we would have stayed here. The place had a friendly vibe (except for one guy who was a bit too drunk) and the bartenders were really cool. The best part was we got a free beer with our yelp check in, definitely can't go wrong with that. Overall I liked the dive bar feel to this place and I would recommend it to anyone staying close.
author: Miguel R.

description: Cool bar in the outskirts of the city, great atmosphere and music. Cool bartenders. Not too crowded, has the sports games on.
author: Danielle D.

description: Great bartenders, laid back almost divey scene.  Pool tables, music, and all the live games played.
author: Chris S.

description: I walked in and ordered a drink, the bartender said they don't take debit cards and to go across the street where I can use the atm. I did use the atm, came back to finish my order. the guy standing in the front said I wasn't allowed inside. I couldn't understand why they treated me that way. My only conclusion is that the staff didn't like the t shirt I was wearing that night. Another bar had a similar reaction, Rude!
author: Sarah S.

description: I like that place. I've been going there for a long time. I love the staff and the bartenders. Super nice and always friendly to me and to the customers. Always busy and that place is always packed. They have plenty of TVs and two pool tables. I've met a lot of interesting people there with whom I've remained friends. Right next door to them is a little taqueria called "Los Hermanos" I go there ALL the time. Just ask my friends...
author: Victor K.

description: Very homey dive bar; no frills. Not one of those pretentious/trendy bars you'd expect to find in the Marina. Very convenient when you want to grab pre or post dinner drinks after dinner on Chestnut Street. The pool tables were closed off the last time I went. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a conversational setting. They blast music really loud, making it hard to hear anyone.
author: Helen C.

description:
For some reason this always seems to be a usual stop when we are in the Bay Area and I am not quite sure why. I love dives and I am not quite sure if Horseshoe quite qualifies. The crowd seems a bit too refined to be a dive but the stiff drinks and reasonable prices level it out a little bit. Perhaps it's an upscale dive?

This place has always been slammed when I've been here - like ten minutes to order a drink slammed. They do have pool tables, a pretty good jukebox and the drinks are stiff. This place is definitely the kind of joint that I would post up at on an early Sunday morning to catch a game and lay down a good base coat. Other than that, nothing too noteworthy about this place.
author: Brad B.

description:
The horseshoe is a great little dive in the marina. Cold beer, friendly staff, pool tables, TV, and lively patrons makes for a great time! 

Check in on yelp for you first drink free, can't really beat that now can you! 

This is not the typical Marina atmosphere which is refreshing!
author: Kristin F.

description:
This place was AWFUL. I brought a friend in with me from out of town into this bar and received deplorable service. The older grumpy bartender Gary should be fired and arrested for his treatment of this bars patrons. 

The bar was crowded. We walked up to the bar and ordered two drinks. Gary went on to get a few orders from a few others at the bar. No big deal. We stayed at the bar and sat down about three bar stools away from where we placed our drink order. Gary the bartender the walks over to us slamming our drinks down spilling them on us SCREAMING, YELLING AND CURSING at the top of his lungs that "we better FUCKING LEARN HOW TO STAY IN THE PLACE WHERE WE ORDED OUR FUCKING DRINKS"! We were speechless, I attempted to apologize to him for the confusion of us siting down three bar stools from where we were originally standing when we ordered the drink. This seemed to aggravate him more. His temper became even more violent and elevated. SCREAMING, YELLING AND CURSING at the top of his lungs to "GET THE FUCK OUT".  Who talks to anyone like this, much less two women who were nice and apologetic?

I left shaking and very upset. I had spent the day at the beach with my best friend. We went there to have a drink and relax. To have to deal with a person this abusive was insane. He should be fired and arrested.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**UPDATE**

I was incorrect about the bartenders name. It was not Corey, it was Gary. An older man with a ponytail. Also, I wanted to make note that the owner Stephen, took the situation seriously. Not only did he apologize to me via email, he took the extra step of calling me to find out the particlur details of the incident and assured me that he would be addressing it.

---------------------------------------------------

Update two--

I received an email from Gary, the bartender whom my friend and I experienced the incident with. He emailed me to apologize. I was very touched.
author: Krystina W.

description:
This place is a dump. Don't come here if you genuinely want a 5 star bar. Go to Bourbon and Branch if that's what you're interested in. 

If you're looking for a divey place to catch a game or a new fling, this is the place. Or dinner - BYOF. Just please, please don't complain about this place. It's not for you if you're a whiner.
author: Aubrey O.

description: Great staff and a fun place to catch a game with friends. Parking in the Marina is always a crapshoot, but Wells Fargo across the street has paid parking if you have sucky parking karma like I do. The Marina crowd is generally friendly and fun.
author: Wayne S.

description: I can't say much about this bar because I was not let in the door. I am a Marine with a legitimate need for a medical service dog, who is both trained and certified. Even though both state and federal law states that I am allowed in, and the dog has been everywhere from doctor's appointments to movies, we were not even let in the door. Furthermore, I even tried to assure the managers, and kindly reminded them that what they were doing was against the law, they didn't care. Though I don't drink, I was visiting and trying to spend time with some local friends and didn't want to make a scene about it and just left. This was a great way to be treated on Memorial Day when both my wife and I are Marines, and she just returned from Afghanistan. I say shame on you, as the reasons why I have the dog are due to injuries related to military service. Thanks guys!
author: Ryan L.

description: I was visiting San Francisco from Texas. I searched yelp for bars that were near my hotel. I chose this place because I had read that they had a particular beer that I was looking for. I asked the bartender for it and she told me they did not have it so I simply asked if she knew where I could find it she wasn't very helpful and a bit rude at that point I did not even want to stay and try something else. Maybe she gets the same question a lot I get it, but I did not feel very welcomed.
author: Bobby D.

description:
This place is Hopping! Unpretentious dive bar with younger decent looking crowd. 

We came here to escape the poison gases at Marina Lounge, and met a bunch of cool people. I was able to catch the Knicks/Laker game, and watch Jeremy Lin kick Kobe Bryant's .... on a nice big Plasma TV. 

It's a bit too hipster for my taste, but it's all good.
author: Dani S.

description:
It's a dive bar but I love dive bars. Cheap drinks and a cheap crowd. No frills which is how we like it. We've been here a few times; can get crowded on the weekends but that tells you how popular it is.

In fact, I almost don't want to write a review, don't want people to know about this place. The more people the more crowded, LOL.
author: Becky M.

description: A great bar to relax after a long day. Conveniently located, with an authentic sports bar vibe - this is the bar for all budgets! The drinks are not diluted, making this a good value for money hang out!
author: Arnav S.

description: Great local dive in the Marina. I'm not super keen on the Marina bar scene but this is a great spot I frequent it for cheap drinks, pool, good laid back vibes. I also love the Yelp check-in they offer (as of the writing of this) 100% off your first drink of ANY drink with check-in. Dope! Also, the Bartenders are awesome.
author: Jason P.

description: How does a free drink sound? CHECK IN AND GET YOUR FIRST FREE DRINK! I stumbled across this place as I was waiting for my name to be called on a waitlist at Tacolicious. What better way to sit around and wait than to sit around and drink? The bartenders are very friendly and attentive. The place is a bit small, so there may be some squeezing in to do, but other than that, this place is great for a quick drink!
author: Jane N.

description: My friends and I had WAY too much fun here this past weekend! Definitely a solid local hangout- a really fun, good vibes, sports, etc.
author: Cherise W.

description:
I come here almost every week to shoot pool with any friend that will want to. It's not your typical Marina bar or crowd which I very much appreciate living in the Marina. The drinks are priced fairly, and the servers are GREAT - super friendly and make you feel welcome in their home. 

Great place to play pool (they have two tables), catch up with friends, or just have a drink solo.
author: Elli S.

description: Verry gut bier! I am german and i know gut bier. Nice location, maybe too much boys here, but no sausage party.
author: Stefan Y.

description: Marina dive bar, great if you are looking for something Marina-lite. Also a great hangout if you are waiting to get into some of the popular restaurants nearby.
author: Michael C.

description: This is such an interesting institution in the Marina district.  It is such a casual, neighborhood place in the middle of high end wine bars.  If you just want to grab a beer and relax, maybe play some pool, this is the place.  Friendly, reliable, and CUTE t-shirts.
author: Greta R.

description: Great dive bar.  The bartender was friendly.  Had a few conversations with my wife and I.  His name was Cory. Nice guy. They stayed open and let us relax when all the other places were either closing early for no reason or ignored us while standing at their empty bar East Side West!!!! Jukebox had everything I searched for.  Which doesn't ever happen.  If ever back in town I would definitely stop by.
author: Gary A.

description:
Best walk in no frills bar near marina. straight talking cool bar staff. good mix clients and no over priced shots .were the locals go but you don't feel like an outsider when trying to get served
like other downtown bars I tried.....
author: Steve W.

description:
This is our go-to bar in San Francisco.  We live on the peninsula and come into San Francisco at least once a month to enjoy all that San Francisco has to offer. We figure after spending the day at the Horseshoe a hotel/motel for the night is cheaper than a DUI!  We usually stay in the Marina and we consider the Horseshoe our local. We have brought friends here from Canada, Great Britain, and Australia.  Whenever we talk about the Horseshoe with our friends, it brings a smile to their faces.

This is not some pinky out drinking establishment.  It is simply the best dive bar San Francisco has to offer.  The bartender, Gary knows his stuff and provides a great environment in which to spend the day.  We usually end up spending the entire day at the Horseshoe and then going to a show in the evening.  Trying to get into the Horseshoe at night can be a challenge - but during the day.... No issues.  I hope to visit it soon.  Cheers!
author: Janet G.

description:
10.31.10

Stopped here after a long birthday dinner for biffle so I can buy him a shot.  He had been drinking since, 5 p.m. or so.  It's about 10 p.m. when we walked in.

The bartenders know how to do their job right.  They know when to cut people off - love this responsibility!

A jaeger bomb for the birthday boy and we're good to go.

Like!
author: Jenny L.

description: Went here for to celebrate the New Year which we did until about 12:50 AM when my party and I were ask to leave by the bouncer for absolutely no reason at all and refused to tell us why. We were having drinks, behaved minding our own business. It's probably because 2 of the members in my party were the only black people in the bar which most likely explains it. So I asked for my card back to  close out my tab and the bartender had the nerve to circle the tip amount she recommended just after asking us to leave. We left a nice little message on how we felt about her and the establishment on the receipt along with a big fat tip of 0. There are plenty of way better bars in the Richmond anyway. Don't waste your time here.
author: Reid M.

description:
Mini-vacation to the Bay one weekend... and my sister & I and her friends came here on Friday night. This place was crowded! It's pretty small too, so that didn't help. It took us about 10 minutes to walk through to the back. 

Not too bad of a bar...
author: Leslie P.

description:
5 stars for Gary's margarita!

In the heart of the Marina, nestled among the trendy boutiques and restaurants, lies the Horseshoe Tavern. It is the only dive bar in the Marina that I know of and its not even that divey. In this tavern you'll find a bartender named Gary who makes mind-blowing margaritas. Ask him to make you one from scratch and you will not be disappointed!
author: Julie T.

description: The staff is great and they bought me 2 shots. I'm from out of town and the hospitality was amazing
author: Shayna C.

description:
Hey -- it's not a Marina bar!  That alone warrants three stars.  I came here on New Year's Eve, which is probably not a great sample of the typical Horseshoe experience.  The bar is spacious, with two pool tables in the back behind a long bar.  There are plenty of TVs, the bar is relatively clean, and the bar staff was quick and professional (which is really hard given the NYE crowds).

I'd definitely head back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Bill H.

description: And this is why Yelp is for the mentally and socially retarded. I read the 3 separate reviews written by one party of women. I've been in the service industry for 20 years and I know Corey and there is no way this actually happened, there just isn't. If you're going to accuse someone of being drunk on the job try and pick someone who isn't 7years sober you shit heel. Corey is hilariously sarcastic and fun so I suggest you take your "service industry" friends and go back to Chevys or Mel's or wherever the fuck you work. Restaurant people don't behave like you. Go find some pretentious mixology bar to hang out at. I'm sure you will be very happy along with your friends. Have a nice day, real service industry people.
author: paulina k.

description: Bartender messed up my friend's drink, and threw him out because he was embarrassed, terrible place.
author: Nick G.

description:
Some friends who live nearby took us here, and I will say that I am definitely a fan. It's a dive-y bar with friendly, generous bartenders that's not pretentious and doesn't try too hard.

The prices are good, and they pour with a VERY heavy hand, so you're definitely getting your money's worth. The beer selection isn't anything to write home about, but will suffice.

All in all, a great place to play pool, grab a drink, and catch up with friends while getting absolutely hammered from the strong drinks.
author: nicholas s.

description:
I noticed a surprising, but very welcome, decrease of popped collar boys and insanely large-sunglassed blonds once I stepped off the street into this little gem of a bar.  And for this area, that alone will get you all the stars there are.

Nice little oasis, then.
author: Meg W.

description: Nothing really notable, it's very small. It looked like a place for regulars, the bartender was really friendly and seemed to know all of the other customers. The other customers were mainly men, all jolly and drinking beer. Chill place, there's pool in the back. Not what I'd heard about the marina it feels very homey, not trendy.
author: Chessie C.

description:
This is a cool place to go for my co-workers and I. I have been multiple times and didn't experience any problems until last night. My friend placed her drink on the arm rest instead of the counter top and the bartender poured her FULL drink out and just decided to to the same to my drink because I was sitting next her her and then kicked us out. Not Cool...

To the bartender CORY, the link below is an anger management website. Please do your customers a favor and sign up. 

http://www.courseforanger.com/?gclid=CjgKEAjw2dqcBRC2q-LXjpfxjnQSJAAeYF5LfK01Hiqpexty3UV4WkMseyLPdhAsyByF7HlBpw-M8_D_BwE
author: Lauren S.

description: Laid back atmosphere. I think it's cash only which is fine. Great TV setup for sports. Had a nice pint of Guinness here. Although the front window was open there were a rather large amount of flies circulating the bar area. I think that could be due to a cleanliness issue.
author: Marty J.

description:
Terrible service - The bartender made a quick assumption about my wife and her three sober girlfriends were not going to pay their tab and had the bouncer kick them out. I tried to ask him why and he yelled in my face, when I was trying to be civil. He admitted that he didn't even know why he kicked them out, obviously he has no brain of his own. 

Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: Bryan K.

description:
When I first walked into this place I could feel the close nit atmosphere here between customers and bar staff.  My bartender looked like Santa clause but he was sweet as pie and a die-hard Giants fan; you can't go wrong there.  I couldn't have found a better place to watch Giants games.

Plus there are like a billion million flat-screens in this place.  God Bless Them!  Anywhere I was I could at least watch two at the same time and they were all of top quality.  

A lot of the times true sports bars with numerous flat screens have varying quality for each TV.  Not here baby, all top notch TVs of the highest picture quality. 

This is my dream sports bar to watch any and all games.  Plus the sign behind the bar is so huge that no matter how drunk or old I was, I could read that sign from a mile away.  Its not only smart but efficient as well.  I'm sure it prevents any stupidity of questions like, "What's on tap?" or "Do you have (insert import beer here) at this bar?"  The sign lists each beer offered here in very large print font. 

The ladies toilet is a bit tricky but there is a sign so just follow directions ladies.  Its not rocket science and doesn't take a college degree to figure it out so try hard and you'll get it.
author: Hazel K.

description:
Came here on New Years day 2013, and I really don't remember much of it, which is pretty much the best recommendation a bar can get in my opinion.

They have a pool table, which is cool if you want to attract some attention because its right in the middle of the room and basically everyone has to watch you. Don't play if you stink, its embarrassing and patrons wont hesitate to mock.

The beer selection is average, but the music, crowd, and atmosphere more than make up for it. They have TV's if you're into sports, and the crowd isn't so rowdy that you cant come in with a girl friend or even your parents if you are so inclined.

Definitely a great place.
author: Palash A.

description:
First time at this place and will definitely be the last. I have never experienced anything like what happened last night at the Horsehoe Tavern Bar.

A few friends had just joined our group and we immediately made our way to the bar to order a round of shots. Long story short, we order the shots and as we stood there talking for about a minute (no joke,) out of nowhere the bouncer informs us that the bar tender demanded that we get kicked out. Completely clueless of what was going on, we asked the bouncer why we were getting kicked out but refused to answer and proceeded to push us out the door. My husband notices, walks over and gets in between us and the bouncer and asks again why we were getting kicked out. The bouncer flips out, starts pushing him roughly and begins to yell at the top of his lungs to get out of his bar while random customers hold him back because it looked like a fight was about to happen.

Once outside, we find out the details from a kind customer who witnessed how it went down. So apparently, after our friend ordered the shots, she was asked twice by the bar tender to pay the tab and because we didn't hear her and pay fast enough, the bar tender found it necessary to go to extremes and have us kicked out. With the music blasting, it didn't even occur to her to perhaps tap one of us on the shoulder and let us know that you wanted the bill paid asap? We didn't move at all from our original spot from when we ordered while two of us were still holding the shot glasses in our hands and your kicking us out for not paying fast enough? 

Let me add, that while we were getting informed of the reason for the unnecessary incident that had just happened, my husband walks over to the bouncer and asks again calmly why we got kicked out. He said, "Let me get this straight. You want me to ask the bartender why the girls got kicked out? You've asked me 4 times now and the answer is no. I'll do it when I have the time," and just stood there with a cynical smile on his face. I mean, really?

After all that, we happily took our group of 17 people to another bar where we would be treated respectfully and rationally.
author: Leslie S.

description: If you're in the Marina...and you don't know why you're in the marina...and you don't want to be in the marina...go to the Horseshoe!!  It's the perfect non-marina bar in the marina.  Such a wonderful dive.  Pool tables, typical dive drinks, regulars who look like dive bar regulars (by marina standards at least), it's pretty great!
author: Allison R.

description: FINALLY! A bar that isn't full of former Greek life members AND is in the marina? I think I just hit the jackpot! The Horseshoe Tavern is a much-needed and refreshing change from the typical Marina crowd, but is still in the same convenient area. The bar tenders are always really friendly, attentive, and willing to make my annoying drink concoctions even though it's not on the menu. The Horseshoe is also full of old-time San Francisco charm, which is becoming harder to come by. This is a MUST bar for locals and/or any people visiting the city! Can't wait to go back :)
author: Molly G.

description:
I'm sorry, but any bar with bartenders who give you a free round on the house after you and you wingman strike out HORRIBLY with three girls at the bar gets my vote for the best anti-marina bar in the marina.

I may be trying to distance myself from the Bermuda-esque D-bag Triangle of Union, Chestnut and Filmore Streets, but if there's a lighthouse on the horizon, it's here at Horseshoe.
author: Mike V.

description: Great bar with bartenders, not mixologists - what is the difference between a bartender and a mixologist?  About ten minutes....   Good prices and not the least bit pretentious. This bar has a rock solid crew that treats customers well, notwithstanding some shots that have been taken at them lately.  I have been impressed with the patience and tact with some really obnoxious people who I have seen go through there.  An absolute "go to" when I am in the area.
author: Martin L.

description: Great service and cheap drinks! Great sports bar-dive in the Marina. Pool tables are a plus. Our first time here and it seems like this place attracts an eclectic crowd...
author: Katie L.

description: Best bar in the marina.  The bartenders take no bullshit and are tons of fun!! No frills, and no idiots tolerated.  If you know your bar etiquette you'll love it here (:
author: Regan C.

description:
Quite a chill tavern -  Very UN- marina, you don't see too many Polo shirts with collars flipped up here. What you do see is good tvs for sports, day time open seating at the bar with people like me actually doing work while sipping an Arnold Palmer or enjoying a pint.
 
COOL bartender. Giants games are always playing so it is very convenient when I could pop in real quick as it's close to 1 of the stores I oversee. After hours, of course despite the fact that I don't have 'normal' hours anyway.

 Evenings and weekends naturally are slammed. Don't expect to find a seat then but do expect to find a fairly attractive crowd & a lot more casually dressed than most other bars in the Marina. Less stuffy too.  Keep the stiffness for your drink.
Or other things that should be ocassionally stiff. Haha
author: Athena S.

description: This is a fine dive bar. Bartenders were nice enough. I'd come back.
author: Luis B.

description: bad beer. BAD BAD BEER . The beer was literally bad. disgusting, they replaced it with another for free but that still tasted funny... perhaps it's just their tap.  Fairly priced for the marina though.
author: Sara N.

description: Shit hole that I can't help but go into to avoid the douche bags in the marina.
author: David L.

description: This is hands down the best bar in the Marina. Brooke is of course the most amazing bartender and will dazzle you with her quick wit, sailor's mouth, and super sonic speed. This place is staffed with the best of the best- I have never had poor service- that said- make sure you are not an idiot...I have seen many a fool get ridiculed for poor bar etiquette- which is- in fact- thoroughly entertaining....did I mention Brooke's quick wit?
author: sharon t.

description: Cheap, takes card, didn't feel like I was in the Marina. Bartender was super sweet, too. I recommend it if you find yourself in the Marina- way better than any other bar I've been to there.
author: Emily D.

description: Sorry to Stephan not joe my bad.  Think my I  phone is starting to die out.  Sorry for reviewing the wrong business and for calling u joe .  Once again I've never been here.  I reviewed the wrong place.
author: Joe B.

description:
Pretty chill spot

Basic bar-no fluff,no fuss
author: Chary E.

description:
Everything you expect of a dive bar:

Grimy feeling - Check
Emo bartenders - Check
Jukebox - Check
Pool Tables - Check

The place is full on most nights and sometimes during the days too. 

Definitely worth a stop in your Marina pub crawl.
author: Assaf B.

description:
Basic bar. 

Decent service. 
Strong Drinks. 
No frills. 
No special cocktails of the night. 

All there is people who enjoy drinking and listening to music.
author: Erica U.

description:
Yes! Way to go Horseshoe Tavern! I dig the unpretentious dive bar that offers an alternative to the "typical" Marina crowd. I'd absolutely come back..and am not sure why I hadn't been prior to St. Patty's Day.

Didn't have much interaction with the staff, other than the guy at the door. When we were trying to leave, we realized half the group didn't follow us out. When I turned around to go back in, I was told I had to wait outside- that I was too intoxicated. The bouncer watched me trip and must have assumed it was due to my consumption... if he only knew that I trip ALL the time, and that coordination is one of my "weaknesses" it may have been a different story.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Ugh, so its hard to say if I am reviewing the bar itself or the people in it. 
Or maybe they are the same...Let me explain.

Went here on a friday night for some drinks with some friends. It was moderately packed but we were able to get our drinks quickly. They had a good selection of beers on tap and the bar tenders where nice. All good. 

After we got our drinks we were sitting in the front of the bar by the open window when two other patrons started yelling and acting like they were going to fight. REALLY? So one gets kicked out one gets to stay. Standing outside the bar with his gf and other friend he keeps yelling obscenities for at least another 5 minutes before the bouncer makes him leave. In the mean time another guy comes up to me and says "my girlfriend was sitting on that stool." Uhhh.....not wanting to deal with him I just got up. But really? He or she wasn't there when we sat down there were no personal belongings anywhere letting me know someone was sitting there. It gets better though, another patron starts yelling at the bar tender calling him names and saying ridiculous stuff to him! Ok seriously? These people were just unbelievable. 

This was all during one drink! We left after our drink was finished.  

Not likely to ever go back if this is the crowd here.
author: Tuesday C.

description: My husband and I love this place.  Always stop by when we are in the area. Aaron is the best bartender ever :-)
author: Nikki M.

description: We went to SF for the Day to do some shopping and my Mom and I decided to grab a drink and get out of the rain. We walked into the Horseshoe hoping to grab a beer and the Bartender completely ignored us! Then when I finally said hey, can we get a drink he yelled NO! Wow, what a jerk! It wasn't even full! You would think he would want the money on a slow rainy day! Talk about Rude!
author: Claire C.

description: Came in just to grab change for the bus but decided to grab a shot as well. Bartender was friendly and helped me navigate the bus route while we drank. They didn't have a drink menu but the bartender was more than capable providing me with good shots.
author: Alicia M.

description: Awesome dive bar, cool bartender, grimy men and bathrooms. Fast service, fast men --overall great time.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I came here the other night before catching Zola Jesus at the Palace of Fine Arts. The Marina type is a person I generally try to avoid-- and Horseshoe Tavern is the perfect place to do that.

Highlights:

-It wasn't crowded

-The bartender was a nice lady!

-The folks in there were friendly. One guy grabbed bar stools for me & my buddy

-Very reasonably priced drinks

If you're a rad, dive-loving human, this is your spot to grab drinks before a show at the Palace of Fine Arts.

Oh heyyy- and they take cards.
author: K M.

description:
On weekends the crowd, and the general grime, got to me at times.  Plenty of beers on tap in the Marina make this a good spot though.  

Ever since the bartender took the last third of my bourbon away, only to ask if I wanted another, I haven't been back.  I mean really, how busy could that woman have been on a Tuesday?  Wait, I know, I was there - she wasn't that busy.  Everyone in the bar area had a seat.
author: Mike H.

description: Drop by and see Gary. This place is the best in the marina if you just want a good place to have a drink and hang out. Great tacos across the street too.
author: Derrick G.

description: I LOVE this bar!! I love the older, rustic feel. I love the fact that it is not the typical marina bar, more of a hangout comfortable place to grab strong, cheap drinks. Bartenders are awesome. I am hesitant to say such good things bc I feel like this is such a hidden gem!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Chill, good price, nice bartenders, pool area in the back.  

However, the 2-stars is mainly for the fact that everyone here is really old.  I guess I'll enjoy it more in 10 years.
author: Liz W.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the Marina! Super chill spot! Most people that frequent this bar are locals that know about this gem. I heart the dive-bar feel, music, and the bartenders are awesome; Aaron is the man there! 

It's a stone's throw away from my apartment as well!  Im able to Enjoy my drink, watch the latest game on, and not have to be bothered by the douche-frat boys. This spot does not attract the bridge and tunnel crowd that come in to the Marina on the weekend. In my opinion, that's who's given the neighborhood a bad rep. 

So If u wanna just go to a mellow spot to enjoy a beer or your traditional drinks; this is the best place on chestnut to do so!
author: Christina S.

description:
Every other bar on chestnut is either super pricey or just impossible to get a drink at. So I'll give it to horseshoe for being attentive and mellow. 

But I went there 2 days in a row and got inconsistant drink prices for the same drink, and I already don't like when some bars are just to cheap to buy redbull, so intead they use monster or rockstar for vodka+redbulls. Gross. 

I also didn't receive a very welcoming vibe.... maybe because I'm a dodger fan? Can they smell my blue blood? Can they smell the sadness of defeat leaching out of my pores?
author: nicole r.

description: Best bar in the Marina. To those of you who are "in the industry" and don't know bar etiquette, kick rocks.
author: la boca J.

description:
Their T-shirts say it very eloquently: The "non - marina" marina bar. Visit this place whenever we're in the City because we usually stay close to the Marina. Went in around 8pm on a Friday and hadn't gotten crowed yet so nabbed a couple seats at the bar. Prices are pretty reasonable for the area and even though I didn't have one, the Oly was flying out of the coolers so they must be a REAL steal.

Saw they had Magners cider and was excited but alas, they had changed and I'm pretty picky about my ciders. Bartender was awesome and comped me a beer. Needless to say that was a very smart customer service move. We stayed for 3 drinks then mosied on our way.

Can get very packed later on what with the pool tables and all but prefer this bar to the one across from the Marina theater.
author: Eastsac G.

description:
This place fits in the category of "4 stars during the week, 1 star on the weekend".

When it's only kinda busy, the 'shoe is actually a great bar.  It really doesn't seem too Marina-y during the week.  Good pool tables, good bartenders, and the crowd on a Tuesday is relaxed and fun.

On the weekend, it's just crowded, and full of attitude.  

The funniest thing I saw in here was a young woman trying to talk on her RAZR phone and take a shot on the pool table at the same time.  Absolutely the most awkward moment of the evening for everyone involved.  I struggled mightily to get my phone out in time to take a picture, but she realized that hers was a lost cause and put the pool cue down.
author: Nelson W.

description:
It's always nice to find a really good dive bar! And this is one your sure to enjoy.  It doesn't get a 5 star for dive bars, for I don't want to betray my favorite dive!

Good people, flowing beer, and location is what makes this place. Not to mention the pool tables, tvs, and DART BOARDS!!!  Woowhoo...

Cheers!
author: Dee C.

description:
This rat hole has been here as long as I can remember and is one of the popular bars to go to for those that just want to get stupid drunk. It also is a great place to catch anything from emotional breakdowns to delusional confidence to alcohol poisoning to fights. This is your place if you want to re-live your college stupid-drunk experiences. Yep, that means Thursdays are often as busy as Saturdays.

Waa hoo MF!
author: Mike B.

description:
horrible horrible horrible!!! 

that bartender cory is the worst bartender you can ever come across. seriously has major anger issues.

i would really appreciate my money back for the two full drinks you poured out because you got angry for no reason!!!!
author: Monica S.

description:
After leaving the Nitecap in the 'loin, this was the first bar in the marina that we hit for Cinco de Mayo.  Not by choice, but convenience.  Wasn't planning to come here, but the others wanted a drink and I needed a bathroom...fast!  Anyway, it was okay.  We all had a quick drink and left.  I used to like this bar a lot more in the past, especially since it has pool tables, but lately, it just doesn't do it for me.

As always, the Horseshoe is middle of the road.  Not upscale or fancy, but not a true dive either.  The best thing I can say about this place is that it's reliable.  It won't wow you, but it's always there and convenient if you're in the area.

Haven't shot pool there in ages...will have to go back again someday when it's not a drinking holiday.
author: Roy N.

description:
This is probably the bar that I visit the least in the Marina but not because I hate it but only because it's one of the harder places to get into. It's always packed too tight. And not that it's THAT popular, it's that once people get it, they stay towards the front and crowd the entrance.

Anyway, there are tons of bars in the Marina and you can basically get the same drinks and beers anywhere but it's about which ones are the most welcoming. This one isn't as welcoming for me but you can tell that there are people here who consider this one their go-to bar so I say just visit all of the ones in the Marina and you decide which vibe you like the most.

I recommend this as much as the other like-bars on Chestnut. I would say that there are better bars to watch the game though.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Right, so, I can't believe I've lived here this long and still haven't reviewed my oldest neighborhood haunt (other than the Grove)! I'm a long-time Marina local, and have come here off and on since '97, shunning most other bars in my neighborhood. 

Am I a fan? Yup. It is a sports bar, so like any bar you're experience will really depend on the crowd that shows up on any given night. Over the years I've typically had good experiences here. The bartenders have changed over the years, but it's awesome to still have Stef involved (yes, he's the former Yankees pitcher and all-around cool dude).

The place is littered with TVs and some game is always on - no matter what sport you're into, it's on at some point. There are a couple pool tables in back (with the obligatory missing ball or two that have substitutes) and a jukebox with a selection that hadn't changed for years last I checked - it's all definitely part of the Shoe's charm (seriously). The bartenders have ALWAYS been awesome and friendly, and if you become a regular they will take extra good care of you. The place gets PACKED on Friday and Saturday nights, so if you don't like crowds, this isn't your spot.

What else can I say? It's just a great spot to come catch up with people, get out of the house, blow off steam when you need to, or wind down after a long day at work. I've seen all sorts of people come through here over the years - sailing crews celebrating after a race, softball teams pounding down brews after a game, Giants fans having a couple before and after games, people drowning their sorrows, drunk fratboys and the legendary Marina girls, and then non-locals that ordinarily bash the Marina who show up wanting so badly to be accepted as a Marina local. 

It's all good - it's what makes life interesting, it's how you meet cool people and have some fun. For my drinkin' money, there's no better place for this than the Shoe. God love it.

Oh yeah, don't show up hear wearing ANYTHING with a Dodgers logo on it! :-)
author: Gregg G.

description: I've been in this bar 3 times. Nothing really special but it's perfect after work for some pool shooting and few beers. It's always been fun until last night. After most of our coworkers left 3 of us (girls) stayed to finish our drinks (me and one of the girls shared a beer) and the other had her drink (full, since she just got it). As we talk my friend with the full drink had a sip and placed it on the armrest of the bar. The bartender (Cory) told her that she'll spill it so she should put it on the bar. She told him not to worry since she's not one of these people who spills or knocks their drinks off (keep in mind that we also work in the food and beverage industry and have seen plenty so we know how to behave and where it's safe to put drinks and food without making a mess). Obviously, he didn't like that and got mad. He took her drink and dumped it. Then looked at my other friend and said "In fact, I don't like you either!", took her beer and dumped it too and kicked us out. Not fair at all. Being an asswhole is not the way to keep customers coming. Or was that because of the alcohol amount he drunk?
author: Kristina K.

description:
My friends and I found ourselves in the Marina; we'd just gone to dinner at Isa and planned to go to SoMa for a night out.  To make life easier, we decided to just stay in the Marina and go some place where the guys wouldn't have any problem getting in (and where there wouldn't be any line issues at all).

We decide on Circa which is a reliable place to grab drink...but there was a ridiculous line.  When i say ridiculous, I mean almost to the end of the block (which I think is fair assessment).  The line isn't moving at all...and we weren't wedded to Circa, so we decide to hit up my friend's favorite dive in the neighborhood, Horseshoe Tavern.

As soon as we walk in, I realize that it is all guys...and I mean all guys.  There were probably just under 10 ladies there that night....and a bar packed with men.  So if you're looking for a place to pick up on guys (or have them pick up on you, rather), this is the place.  I can understand why too - the drinks are pretty cheap, the bartenders are fast and there are a number of TVs around the bar.  Clearly, they are trying to please both women and men - Oprah (or Dr. Phil?) was on in one corner and Sports Center was on in the other.  There are pool tables in the back, though the lights are a little too bright back there...too, too bright.  If you don't mind being pushed and shoved at the front of the bar, then you can stake a claim within eye contact of the bartender.

The night was definitely better than it would've been across the street, and the place and the crowd were certainly more entertaining.  If I'm in the 'hood, I'll be back...
author: Wendy L.

description: This bar is super divey and does not allow dogs (although there are no signs anywhere that indicate that pets are not allowed). I would not recommend this bar. There are quite a few nicer bars in the area.
author: Fanny C.

description:
a great place to get a liquor in your system.  The place can get packed in the weekends but with great friendly people. 

I am a repeated customer.
author: X M.

description: Barkeep is really nice. Prices are what they are (expensive, but you know you're in the Marina), and the clientele aren't too rowdy. They have an electronic jukebox that gets updated, 2 pool tables that require quarters, a couple of arcade gambling games, and a decent lineup on tap. They also have 4 or 5 tvs that broadcast Giants, A's, Sharks, and an assortment of NBA games. Not too shabby. Their beers on tap taste kind of flat though. The CO2 tank could use a change.
author: Danny C.

description:
I want one of the tank tops!

Each and every time I have come here it hasn't been an overly memorable or farce experience... it's pretty mellow. I will go ahead and assume the reason is since the crowd always seems to be there solely to watch sports, not swoon on the girls at the bar. However, this proves it's not the typical marina bar and makes me like it even more. Sometimes I watch sports, too... sometimes!
author: Kristin F.

description: The bartenders and their fuckin 80s hair metal music. Take your white snake and put it in the fuckin trash.
author: Bobby M.

description:
About as "dive-y" as it gets in the Marina area. People are chill, bartenders are cool, and drink are stiff. Two pool tables in the back, which are usually open for the pool sharks. 
The bar is at the end of Chestnut, near Fillmore, so you can get away from the prissy riff-raff most people try to avoid down the block. 
All in all, good bar, good people...let the good times roll!
author: Jenn H.

description:
Came here after work for drinks at 11pm.
Bartenders are always super nice.
There are way lot more men than women.
They (the guys) didn't bother my girlfriend and I chatting, 
as we were grossly immerse in conversation.
So all in all, it's a cool place to hang out with your friends.
This was a weekday - wed, so it was not packed.

If you come on the weekends, be forewarned it can be 
packed and feel like a frat party. This is when you can barely get the the bar to order a drink. So when a super nice bartender gets to you, you should order two drinks because you don't have to come back and order again.     Cheers!
author: Debbie N.

description:
Great bar. Just really what a sports/pool bar should be. Polite service, nice open windows, hooks under bar for jackets and purses... no frills. nice large flat screens everywhere for the games. 

*this is probably getting 5 stars because cal beat stanfurd to get their 1st time winning pac-10 title in 50 years...even after taking away their rose bowl title late last year* hehehe CAL RULES!!!!!!!!!! but i digress.

well i agree with the shirts: this is definitely the 'non marina bar in the marina.' perfect!

bathroom is what you would expect in sf: broken, smelly, gross.
author: Joyce D.

description:
Pretty awesome place. Cool staff, fairly mellow people. Love the juke box, but some people do pick God awful songs. A local haunt for a couple of my SF friends, and any time I go with them I have a good time. Though beware... Saturday its JAM PACKED. Like 101 North before a 49ers game. Good luck getting anywhere. 

 Oh... and dammit if you don't know the words to Don't Stop Believin by Journey don't sing it! That song comes on and everyone in The Shoe becomes a karaoke contestant. Except all they know is "DON'T STOP BELIEVINNNN" and the rest sounds like that noise that babies make when they're just sitting there trying to talk to themselves.
author: Katrina G.

description:
The Horseshoe is still the Horseshoe.
I was actually surprised at how quiet it was when I was last in.  It was a kind of a gloomy rainy day, just after the excitement of the Giants winning the world series, plus it was a Raiders game day (scoff) - all of which probably explains the sports fan ennui.
I have only ever been into this bar during daylight or early evening hours for sports watching and beer drinking, so it seems that I'm missing the jerks and getting the older locals and low key younger folks who just want to have a beer and watch some sport or play a game of pool on a lazy afternoon in a non pretentious local bar.  
I guess that's my tip for you then: go during the day.
author: Jennifer D.

description: The non-marina marina bar.  If you are from or live in SF, you know what I mean.  Good spot with good prices.
author: Ryan M.

description: SF's best dive bar. The bartenders are all awesome. Very chill atmosphere. Fun spot to watch any sports game. And i'm pretty sure everyone here is friends. If you visit SF, you need to visit this spot.
author: Jack G.

description: Fun place for drinks and pool! Only 5 blocks from Ft. Mason Green. Gary the bartender is a nice guy!
author: Kevin R.

description:
Horseshoe Tavern is A-OK in my book. Pretty standard dive sports bar. Almost don't feel like you're in the Marina, both in vibe and patrons, which I appreciated when I got there for Hump Day drinks.  

My companion is a regular, so we were instantly greeted as we sat at the bar. It was a beer kind of night...followed by a couple of huge shots of Hennessy (ekkkkkks!). The bartender was super friendly and fun, even paid for our first round of shots. 

Love that you can bring outside food (try the burritos next door, they are pretty tasty and humongous), the hooks underneath the bar for your purse and coat, and that the decibel level is not too loud that you have to raise your voice. There's a pool table. Definitely plenty of televisions tuned in to different sporting events. Decent selections of beer on tap...they had my fave Blue Moon, which instantly earns them points in my book. 

Definitely a nice, reliable, "good time bar."  I'll likely go again, as I mentioned my companion is a regular, and I hope to be a regular companion of his.
author: Marie B.

description: We went to the Horseshoe with a huge group of guys and had a killer time.  Great bartenders, drinks and prices!!!!
author: Chris H.

description: I'm a fan. The drinks are solid, the bartenders are quick and its the non marina marina bar.
author: Grant G.

description:
The Horseshoe has become my luckiest bar in the Marina by far.  A surprisingly fun and entertaining little spot. It has it's fare share of popped collars and crafty cougars - but still manages to maintain a chill vibe for a "Marina dive". Full of jukeboxes, pool tables, friendly bartenders, and great drink deals, it's worth a stop on your next Chestnut walk. 

Who knows... maybe you'll find luck at the 'Shoe too!
author: Caroline J.

description:
Not really my neighborhood, but a decent enough bar.  Definitely packed late on a Friday night.

Good Amber Ale beer. 

There's a back section to the bar with pool tables that opens up a bit if you're looking for some more room. This place had a very "Marina" type crowd.
author: Charles R.

description:
Recap of the last two times I've been there...

First time, a random sunny Sunday afternoon. Blue Moon on tap (love it!), and shots of Sambuca after we heard "Sex is on Fire" (I don't have time to explain, but thanks a friggin' lot Mike!). "Party in the USA" is on juke box. Yeah, they loved us for playing it 4 times in a row. I don't remember the rest, but Monday sucked.

Last time, this past Cinco de Mayo. Drunk girl cheers' me and breaks her pint glass. I offer to get her a new beer. The bartender is real nice and pours her a fresh beer. Drunk girl thinks he just took her old beer and poured it in a new pint glass. I assure her that was not the case. She is skeptical, but drinks her beer anyway. 5 minutes later, she drops her pint and it smashes all over the floor. No one touched her or anything. She is scared that she'll be kicked out (as she should be), but she is not. Nice people down at the Shoe. I don't remember the rest, but Thursday (the next day) sucked.

I can't wait to go back!
author: Dave L.

description:
met up with a buddy and his girlfriend to watch the dodger game here (i mean the giants game - forgot.).  I've been here tons of times but felt i should continue my review streak.  While i was pointing out the available tshirts etc available for purchase, we were a bit distracted by the dozen or so flies that seem to hover 10 feet above the bar.  Aside from that - its a bar. and a dive. and the drinks are cheap and strong.  This is an easy bar to meet people in - there's always a few drunk chicks just hanging out- waiting for a fratastic sweet bro to hit on them. 

the place is always packed - to a point of annoyance - in the evenings.  But is definitely a fun spot for day drinking. if you have to be in the marina.  check it out.
author: Mike B.

description:
Okay, I am a "Yelp as I go" sort of gal. I do not write about a place I visited prior to joining Yelp unless I visit it again. Then, and only then, do I run home excitedly to tell you all about it.

However.......

I am on the wagon, and this is going to completely mess up my bar vs. everything else review ratio, thus destroying my reputation as the fearless leader of the bar crawls I host, and I cannot allow that to happen....so, for the next few weeks, I am going to have to delve into my past and Yelp a few bars I have no intention of ever returning to. 

Horseshoe is one of them. 

Primarily because it is one of the few bars I have been kicked out of. Kick me out once shame on you, kick me out twice shame on me, so not going back brings no shame to me and bounces it back to the stupid bar that kicked me out the first time. Thats my demented logic and I am sticking to it!

The reason I got kicked out was stupid, too. The bartender was super rude to me on a prior visit to another bar he worked at, for no good reason at all. So, I walk in, see him here and say, in a very conservative volume, to my friend "That guy was such an asshole to me last week, I hope we get better service today". 

Talk about supersonic hearing! The dudes head turns around exorcist style as he screams "What did you just say about me?"

So I repeat that I found his service to be less than friendly (in my own words), to which he responds "Get out now". 

Way to prove me wrong the second time around, guy!

(figures this happened in the Marina, whos surprised??)
author: Drue C.

description: I know people who call this a dive, but I love it. The bartenders are nice and know how to pour a great drink. It's dark at the bar, but lightens up near the two pool tables in the back. If it's quiet, check out all the photos of old San Francisco on the walls. Fair prices too.
author: Alexandra B.

description: Very cheersy marina dive. Friendly staff, very tight fit inside, but good stiff drinks, good beers on tap, has a cool crowd. Overall one of the better bars in the area
author: Nick F.

description:
Anyone else a huge fan of those TVs that have all the bar games you can play for a dollar?  Stay away from the blackjack and other nonsense.  My game is Photo Hunt  (also goes by What's the Difference?).  Most specifically, Erotic Photo Hunt.

The Horseshoe is fun because this bar easily has the best geographic position of Photo Hunt that I have ever spotted in any bar ever.  It's not on the bar (a huge mistake some places make -- it takes up valuable real estate and any players get jostled by drunks trying to get drunker).  It's in a corner just past the bar near the pool tables.  Plenty of room for stools, a shelf for you drinks, and enough room to comfortably gather up to 8 of your newest barfly pals to help you determine that Photo A has two boobs exposed whereas Photo B only shows one boob.

Grab your seat, pony up your buck, and spend up to 20 minutes (if you're as good as me!) on staring at washed-out would-be porn stars to figure out the flaws in their photos.  Good crowd to make a few friends while playing -- the crowd is heavy on the dudes, but definitely not a meat market.
author: Deidre B.

description:
I have to admit I've always had a good time at Horseshoe Tavern, and it does by and large live up to its reputation as a non-Marina Marina bar. The last time I was there was this Saturday, sort of post Union Street Festival.

The streets and bars in the surrounding area were filled with drunken striped shirt guys and overtly drunk girls with too much flesh showing, and while some of that scene spilled over to the Horseshoe, the crowd alway remained somehow much more real and friendly. This is probably one of the few, if only, bars I'd consider going to as a regular in the Marina, and that says a lot!

The bartenders are really friendly, and despite a thirsty clientele, ready to efficiently pour you a cure to whatever ails you. And in most cases cases here, that ailment is sobriety! 

The jukebox is filled with the usual assortment of rock standards, but there's enough to have some fun with. There is a pool table in back, but I found that area too well lit. Bars should be dark and shadowy.

Special bonus - they open at 8am on weekends!
author: Nish N.

description:
On Chestnut... or as I fondly refer to it, "The Nut." 

Yeah, I've played air guitar here once. Happened after being thrown out of the Bambuddha Lounge for throwing a drink at the owner. 

For that reason the Horseshoe holds a special place in my heart.

Only problem, I had to play air guitar to Aerosmith. Not my band of choice, but it worked. -1 star for Aerosmith.
author: Trixie M.

description:
In spite of the location (sorry...I think I'm just a little too old and brunette for the Marina), this place is probably in my top five favorite bars within a quick bus trip from my apartment. The bartenders are awesome; they make strong drinks upon request and serve them up with a great sense of humor. This is also where I go to practice pool - most of the time people will watch you, and in my case, laugh at how pathetic I am :)

Anyway, it can get crowded so I prefer Mondays and the occassional Thursday when I'm feeling social, but for the most part the clientele are nice enough. It's one of the more down-to-earth places in this part of the city. 

Last detail - the guys at the front door are cool as hell and joke around with you during your cig breaks, between checking IDs.
author: Hilary L.

description:
I LOVE the SHOE.  

Actually, I just love shoes... 

And horses ... 

Eww, not in *that* way you sicko!!!

Perhaps all the other spots have last call too early on Chestnut, so we tend to end up here in a drunken slosh at the end of the night...
author: lulu p.

description:
Let's clarify what exactly is meant by "Non-Marina Marina Bar": that means it's where the Marina types go when they're tired of the Matrix/Fillmore scene.  It does not mean it's where us Non-Marina types should go when they're in the Marina; by our standards it's still very much a Marina bar.

I think they're going for the whole bare-bones dive bar thing, with a small size and nothing but a couple pool tables and TVs for flavor.  But I dunno, somehow being jam-packed (and I do mean packed) with all the same people who just finished watching the Big Game at Bus Stop spoils the effect.  Getting to the bar was a typical ordeal, and then the bartender got all miffed when I asked for a shot of the house scotch, like I'm supposed to ask for a particular brand or something.  No other bartender has ever seemed to mind...

Of course, in the mob-happy Marina party scene, timing is everything, and we were here at the 12:00 peak traffic.  In fact, we were only here because Mauna Loa Club was too full and turned us away (and really, I couldn't blame them, especially since we were a group of like 10).  Who knows?  Another time or another night the 'Shoe could have been a great place to fire up a game.  My Marina-dwelling coworkers swear by it, in fact.
author: Wes M.

description:
I don't usually post on yelp because I generally don't have much to say one way or the other about most places, but I had such an awful experience at the horseshoe tonight that I had to post something. 

In short, the bouncer/doorman is the biggest D-bag I've met in a long time, and that's saying a lot.  The bar staff decided that closing time would be 1:40 tonight which seems arbitrary but I guess it's fine (lame). The D-bag in question walks up to the pool table where we're about to finish a game, clears the balls off the table into the pockets while I'm trying to take a shot and tells us to "get out now!" When my buddy insisted on staying until his girlfriend came out of the bathroom so he could make sure she was OK, the bouncer told him that "she'll be fine, it's time for you to go." I understand that the bar staff works hard and sometimes they just want to close and go home. I've been kicked out of plenty of bars in SF (usually a little closer to 2AM) and it's generally fine, but I've never been treated so crappy, even when I've been a drunk idiot and deserved to be kicked out (which was not the case tonight). I guess since the bar was closed and I couldn't spend any more money, I wasn't really worth respecting. This experience was so negative that I am officially boycotting the horseshoe for good.

I know most people won't be affected by this review because you hang out in the Marina and you go where your buddies go to meet people and be seen -- but if you have the option I highly recommend passing on the horseshoe.
author: Orin B.

description: When I arrived at this place it was raining outside and when I went in someone offered me some napkins to dry off, that was really nice of them. Even though it was pretty busy I was able to order a beer really fast and the people who were in here were a nice mix, not too douchy.
author: Nicholas A.

description:
Nice and laid back place to hang out on a lazy afternoon. Came here for a drink, hanged out and watched some baseball game. Have a pool table if you want some sports action yourself. I had the Irish Coffee and man, the Whiskey was strong and plenty! Gave me a good alcohol and caffeine buzz!

Service was friendly and not disturbing, which was great!
author: T L.

description:
I go here because it is where my friend Jodi works.  She is cute... hot even... go give her a big tip.

So, why 5 stars for a cute bartender right?  Well, she get 4 stars and so does the bar... nothing special at all... However, I did meet the manager here one time and she said something about her and I starting some world tour comedy thing together... and something about a donkey. Anyone that can recognize my comedy and throw in a quip about a donkey is getting 5 stars. Bo-ya.
author: Thadd L.

description:
For this neighborhood, the Horseshoe Tavern is a bit out of place. It's quaint, small and doesn't apologize for it. It doesn't try to be something it's not; It's a bar, a place where people come together to socialize and imbibe liquids that make the eyes warmer and the laughs louder, without the sick desperation of kids trying to get loaded. 

This is a nice place to get away from the usual collegiate scene of the Marina. It reminds me of some ski lodge bars, because everyone is in pretty casual clothes, yet you know most are doing well for themselves. So if a chill night out on the town is that you're up to do. Check this place out.
author: Douglas L.

description:
When I first got to this bar, I was thinking to myself "why does everyone think that this is a non-marina bar?"  But then I went to Bar None, and like a slap in the face, I remembered what a true Marina bar feels like.  So that bumped the Horseshoe up a star for me.

It was really crowded when I got there, and in the front of the bar was all the typical Marina crowd - you all know what I'm talking about.  However, I went to the back of the bar, and although it was brightly lit (which is never good for a bar), it was a much cooler atmosphere.  People were actually nice and down to earth there.

The beer was really cheap, and although it was crowded I was able to get a drink quickly, which was surprising.

I got the feel that this bar would be a lot better during the week or the day.  I would definitely come for some Saturday or Sunday football games.  On a Friday night though, I don't feel that the Horseshoe is at its best.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
When you're out in the marina and you're just not feeling like being a total douchebag, make your way to the Horseshoe and chances are youll be happy you did.  Drinks are reasonable and become even more so if you take the time to chat it up with the bartender, the jukebox is loud enough to rock the whole spot, and the pool table is just shitty enough to make a terrible player pass for mediocre.  Its a great first stop or last stop of the night and always guaranteed to have someone worth chatting with inside.

Only drawbacks are the bathrooms (there are much nicer driveways and doorsteps in the marina to soil) and the lack of pitcher service (cmon what kinda dive bar doesnt serve pitchers??)
author: Brian H.

description: Walked in for a few drinks with friends.  It was an off day and it was pretty empty.  I couldn't help but notice the terrible music playing -- no bar owner would stand for the Eagles (or ACDC or whatever) to be played 5 times in a row, right?   Then it would just be total silence for 10 minutes.  I asked the bartender if they could resume the awful 80s rock -- he then rolled his eyes then pointed to a juke box and told me to put quarters in it.   I have heard people call it a dive bar -- but the drinks aren't cheap.  Owner: get rid of the juke box and by a $200 ipod.
author: James R.

description: I recently moved from Seattle, and have been a little disenchanted with all the douchers in the Marina area so I was glad to wander into this place.  It has a bit of a divey feel, which was exactly what I needed - very unpretentious, good strong drinks, pool tables.  I was there on a Thursday night, left a little on the early side and it was getting pretty packed, so I could see that being a downside, but overall it was a comfortable and fun place.
author: Angela R.

description:
Still lots of white dudes in striped shirts... 

But you know what... they specifically call themselves a non-Marina bar, which makes me want to point out all the ways they ARE a Marina bar.  When I think of some of the other bars in this area though... this place isn't bad...

Totally sober, I met two friends who'd been drinking all night.  
They thought it was great, so I'll up the stars.  

I won't make a special trip back over here, but if I am in the neighborhood I will pop back in to compare.
author: Megan G.

description: I love this place, my favorite San Francisco Giants hang here, and the fun they usher in, especially Lincecum and Wilson. Two of the funnest baseball players I have ever met and I have met quite a few. You tend to know when they are headed out if you are on their tweet list and chat regularly with them, they warn you they are headed to where ever and you better get there before they do ha! Anyway, on to the review this is not a Giants review. The place is pretty big and can crowd up quite fast. It may get crowded but you do not miss getting a drink by going dry, the bar staff keep a close eye on you and when you are a "chug" away they have a new drink waiting, this has gotten me into trouble many a time lol. The staff and clientele that are there make this for a fun evening, even Phillie fans like it ;-)
author: Henry F.

description:
The Horseshoe Tavern is one of my favorite bars in SF.  Aaron was one of my first bartenders here in the city, Go East Coast!  Love him and all my other favs; Gary, Brooke and of course the owner, Stefan.  I played on their pool team for bit.  Such fun.  You know you are home when as soon as I walk in there is a glass of Pinot Grigio waiting for me. 

Totally packed on Friday and Saturday nights, therefore I tend to go during the week so that I can get some face time with my local peeps.
author: Angel L.

description:
This is a tough review to write because my expectations are so low for a Marina bar and in some ways Horseshoe fully met those low expectations.
