For example, it took waay too long to get bar service here.  I would say 8-10 minutes and that was before Anyone on my end of the bar received service.  It wasn't even that busy!  So, management.  Bring in either another bartender or a significant barback.

Second, the crowd is no better than anywhere else in the Marina.  Meaning, I feel old at 27 and very mature.  Dudes were friendly enough but not buying drinks of course (see: immature). 

Third, some bitch pushed my friend for some inane reason.  Honestly, I don't remember, but this chick seriously open palm pushed her.  I think it may have been because my friend was a little stumbly, and I could support an elbow or dirty look, but shove?  (see:immature)

So, the decent level of stars goes to the bartender that actually ended up taking care of us.  Not only did he almost completely remove his shirt at my request (it was a joke, but I appreciate a man who continues a joke).  He also bought us a round of shots.  Probably because I was coherent and nice to him, had eye contact, you know.  

So, bartender, two stars for you!
author: laura g.

description:
As my profile indicates, I am the lone Colts fan in San Francisco.  I have been to the Horseshoe a few times during the off season on weeknights, and it never dawed on me that it was a Patriots bar.  Why is it?  So I chose the bar last minute because it represents the Horseshoe, the symbol of the colts.  Of course, as soon as we walked in the joint, we were made aware of the fact that it's a Patriots Bar....Everyone was totally cool, and let me stay and didn't dump their drinks on me.  In fact a few of them even sent drinks over to us....and I am here to write about it so there couldn't have been anything too bad in there.

Very impressed that there was only 1 bartender on site, but she knew her way around the bar and no one was thirsty.  Also,  think it's the perfect size  with a good jukebox and pool tables.  And the bathrooms were clean.  Only downer is that they don't have food, but I guess you can order in.  And it's a good meat market selection.  Lots of cute New England boys frequent here!  Although, they weren't smiling at the end of the night...........
author: Amy Z.

description:
Great bar. Meredith is awesome. I've always been made to feel welcome here.

If you don't like "Marina" scenesters, then you MAY want to stay out of here on Thursday and Friday nights - as that is when the "Flip Flop Nation" makes is largest and most noticeable appearance.
author: Steven M.

description: Last night I proved that I am the worst pool player ever...and display too much affection in a public place..but thankfully the Horseshoe is one of those places that you can make a COMPLETE ass of yourself and no one will remember...not even you.
author: Mimi T.

description: I come here after softball games at Moscone, and I love this place.  The bar tenders are super cool, the atmosphere is awesome, the locals who go here are really friendly.  Great place to hang out with friends.
author: Spencer S.

description:
Great place to hang out and have a few. Very friendly place and the crowd is pretty cool. Drinks are strong and priced well.
 I love the dog bowl out front that says two drink minimum. The man who works on the weekends, during the day is super sweet. He is the reason we decided to check this place out. Can't remember his name at the moment!
author: Lisa A.

description: This is my favorite Marina bar. They have the best staff - the guy at the door is super nice and the bartenders are so friendly AND they make good, strong, drinks (brooke is my personal favorite). Its a little crowded on weekend nights so its a great first or last stop if you are bar hopping down Chestnut.
author: Shannon K.

description:
Casual bar in the marina. I always have fun when I go there.
They have golden T and pool. cash only though- wells fargo across the street.
author: Scott K.

description:
Fine.  This local waterhole, I mean like 50 feet local to me, is your laid back sport bar complete with plasmas, quarter pool tables, and a wide range of draft beers (Trumer Pils is awesome).  A cool spot to grab a quick one, socialize with your fellow softball buddies, or even sit and catch a ball game.  

The bartenders are always fun and definitely pour the drinks stiff, for your pleasure.  The selection of spirits is OK.  Being a big scotch drinker, I am satisfied but not impressed.  If they added more snacks, I'd be happier too.  They don't serve anything else but beer nuts, that do come fresh in a bag.

When you walk in, you definitely feel some sort of Marina history.  Plaques, trophies, pictures, and autographed items add to the decor.  Lots of social clubs use the joint as meeting grounds so every night is a crap shoot for chill or for wildin' out.   

Overall, great place to stumble into for a night cap or a beer.

Bathroom sucks.  If you gotta drop the kids off, it would be wise to find another day-care center.
author: Isaac L.

description:
Horseshoe Tavern is my all-time favorite dive bar! Even though it's located across from Circa aka D-Bag central, it's the most anti-Ed Hardy bar in the Marina. 

Hella good drinks, hella good service, laid back, mixed crowd. Always a pleasure :)
author: Anna F.

description:
Cheap drinks, great service (99% of the time) and typically a pretty good crowd...

Pool table in the back - and walking distance to food if you get hungry.
author: Ken S.

description: Very chill place for a quick drink and watching games. Friendly and attentive bartender.. he kept a smile on his face even after drunk girls kept harassing him about braiding his hair while he's trying to tend to customers. Although it seems the crowd is mostly beer drinkers, cocktails are made decent as well.  Cool and friendly crowd, chill ambiance, great service. Oh, this place is Zagat rated 2008 - 2010. Will definitely go back one day
author: Samantha C.

description:
not a bad place to watch a sporting event. many tv's playing many different games, plenty of good beers on tap, and a very friendly staff. 

cant imagine spending a friday/saturday night here though.
author: Andrew D.

description: I just moved here about a week ago and felt like having a beer I so I came here and what a great Idea!  The bartender was awesome as were the people. Thanks!!
author: Tamz O.

description:
I used to live in the building behind the Horseshoe on Chestnut.  This was my "stumble home" bar, meaning that I could have one last drink here and then crawl upstairs into bed.  I never had a bad time here, just bad hangovers the next morning.  

Unlike much of the neighborhood, this isn't a pick-up joint.  You go here with friends or watch the games on the big screens.  

Also they let you bring in Mexican food from next door if you like.
author: Beau G.

description: If this bar were in boston or NYC it would only be a 3 but for where it is I give it a four. Great little bar with a friendly staff and a good selection of beers and some nice TV.s nothing special but nothing douchey either and thats a huge plus
author: douglas B.

description:
Heard Mr. Brightside a few too many times here as well as other songs from the Marina soundtrack for white guys in striped shirts with sweating foreheads and the girls who love them.  Also, you'll still see plenty of ugly guys who must be buxx because they were dating a somewhat vacant hottie 20 years younger than them.

If you compare the 'Shoe to other bars in the area, however, this is certainly an oasis in the midst of a bunch of places that are probably playing Steve Miller's "The Joker".  So, if you do end up in this nabe somehow, you should go here.

The staff were nice and helpful and we had a good time here so I don't want to slight the 'Shoe for still being filled with people who breathe a sigh of relief when they find this place because finally they don't have to go all the way to Blondie's and end up getting their car towed at the end of the night because they parked in the turning lane.
author: Steve B.

description:
I really don't go to this neighborhood very often, I will admit. I will go there to see Sara and Aaron once in awhile and they ALWAYS make me smile!  The music is a blend of old and new which is great if you can get your hands on the jukebox...you can play pool...there are many places to grab a bite to eat nearby.... 

really, it is fantastic.
author: erin f.

description:
Horseshoe Tavern was the second bar we crawled to after getting acquainted with the SF Yelpers during the DYL D-bag event hosted by Vy.

Nothing out of the ordinary jumped out to me to say it was different than any other bar.  I overheard some people outside the place saying this bar has never been so crowded. It must've been all the Yelpers inside overtaking the pool table area. After a start to a long night began in Circa, I was already full of alcohol and didn't order anything. I noticed one of the bartenders who wore shorts and a fleece pull-over.  There were two pool tables in the back and were operated by a coin slot.  The men's restroom was dinky and cramped, and had one upright stall and one toilet.  Whoever opened the door would literally smack the other person in the back while he was washing his hands.
Already tipsy from Circa, our fellow Yelpers were acting like our usual selves proceeding to take naughty pictures, and behaving loud and obnoxious. There was a guy that pulled me aside and asked what we were all about. The curiosity overwhelmed him; he was excited and scared at the same time.  He liked all the wild ladies sprawling on the pool table taking mischievous pictures that their parent's shouldn't see. Oh my!

As soon as the public display of affection was over, the crew abruptly headed out to yet another bar to tackle and get our groove on.
author: Hogan W.

description:
The Horseshoe is the "Red Headed Step-Child" of the Marina, but in a GOOD way! They are unlike any other bar on Chestnut St. Right attitude, location, price and mix of activities. They have a little of everything (Sports, Pool, Golden-Tee and the two brothers right next door). Great for a mid-week drink or ball game, just the two of you or 12 of your best friends. 

The only reason I didn't give them 5 Stars is they are missing a Water-Slide and an All-U-Can-Eat buffet.
author: Caleb A.

description:
A friend who's new to The City asked me to describe some of the bars around town, so here's what I said about the 'Shoe: 

The Horseshoe's kind of a dive-y, SF bar, but the drinks are reasonably priced, the crowd's pretty cool, and the jukebox always has popular, sing-along music playing in the background. There are two pool tables in the back area where a crowd always gathers, and the bar area easily facilitates conversation between strangers. 

The crowd's a little bit older (late 20's-30's) than the typical spots along Union (Bar None, Blue Light, etc.), but it's a good collection of un-presumptuous San Franciscans (if this even exists). The tattooed bartenders are all friendly (and they'll remember what you ordered before). Plus, they have Golden Tee, which is always a nice touch. 

Good place to watch a game, as well, with their projection screen TV's... Just a friendly, home-y place.
author: Mitch S.

description: Great neighborhood bar. It's small but nice and they have two pool tables in the back.   We came on a Saturday around 300pm and there was a neon 80s party going on. We grabbed a beer and the front pool table. FYI, it only costs 75 cents for pool! Their prices must be stuck from the 80's!!!
author: Natalie S.

description:
The Shue is my favorite bar in the Marina, hands down.  I prefer going on weekday nights when it is not as packed as it is on weekends.  

On a school night there is nothing better than heading down to the Shue with a couple of friends, putting a bunch of songs on the juke box (yes, they have Iron Maiden) and consuming whatever adult beverage suits you.

Aaron and Brooke are great bartenders and very friendly.

For those that steer clear because of the crowd, give it a try.  Grab a drink and head towards the roomier back.  In no time the Shue will have you forgetting it is asses to elbows in the front.

The only things keeping it from getting 5 stars are (i) no fox sports package (or any other package for that matter) so it gets very few pac 10 football/basketball games other than cal and (ii) bartenders turn the jukebox off too early (c'mon guys its only 1:15!)
author: Ryan N.

description: Stiff drinks, relaxed atmosphere, decent jukebox, pool tables, reasonable prices - not easy things to find in the Marina! I was visiting family around the corner, and this was the least pretentious place I found during my stay. Bonus points to the guys smoking outside one afternoon who stopped the homeless guy from beating up my pregnant sister and I with a broken mop handle. This place gets 5 stars for what it's not - full of trust fund douchebags and wine snobs.
author: Mindy S.

description:
After a good game of volleyball, my team ends up here. With Pacific Catch or Mexican burritos in hand, we drink our yummy beers watching the base-basket-foot-ball game that is on. 

Great place to meet other athletes. And they have a pool table!! 

Women's bathroom, however only has one stall.
author: Kris O.

description:
How to have a good time at the Horseshoe, in 5 easy steps:

1. Go there any time other than "Marina meat-market" hours.
2. Locate the bartender with a completely shaved head, glasses & a few arm tats.
3. Approach said bartender and in the most lighthearted, yet sarcastic manner possible yell some incendiary East-Coast cultural stereotype that would make a person roil.  (i.e. "The Yankees can suck it!" or "Who do I gotta punch in the face to get a drink around here?  Is it you, a*hole??" or for the truly bold, try "You get trained out of your crushed velvet jumpsuit and gold chain? Never mind, just rustle me up a Roxy Magic Hat and make it snappy").  Just be sure to make it fun for him because he too has to deal with the same clientele in the neighborhood everybody seems so fond of complaining about...
4.  Order a Jameson with a Jameson back and let the fireworks begin.
5.  Trash-talk.  Have a good time.  Done.      

The place is just a place, but it gets 4 starts from me because of that bartender.   I've never witnessed him or any other staff mistreat even the most belligerent of customers.  The trash-talking that goes on between me and the staff makes drinking a more eventful pursuit.  It's like going to Chotchkie's: People can get a drink anywhere but I go for the atmosphere and the attitude...  and while the staff does not adorn their persons with 37 pieces of flair, they definitely know how to express themselves.

I won't go near the place during the Marina meat-market hours, because I can't imagine that I would even like it under those circumstances, but outside of that it's been a fun, low-key place to hang out.  Now if only they would expand their whiskey selection...
author: Bre L.

description: I really liked this place. Played some pool, drank some beer.. what more could you want. Bartender was great. Will definitely go back.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Horseshoe is the best non-scene sorta dive-bar in the Marina. If you're in the Marina and stuck in a lease that is preventing you from getting the hell out, hang out at the Horseshoe. 

This place is really fun and the people are generally anti-triangle (fillmore and greenwich). Good for hanging out and ending out a night.

If you want a real dive bar, check out the Pierce St. Manor - say Hi to CC!
author: Dan M.

description: Small cozy place, 2 pool tables, great company... yay in my book.
author: Helen V.

description:
What a great dive bar. Small, crowded, friendly, lots to see and people to meet.
Every time I roll into San Francisco I hit this bar.
Have yet to have a bad time there or even get any static for weaing my San Diego Padre gear.
Have a shot, their small.
author: Eddie W.

description: Game 3 Giants World Series.  Found a spot to sit at the bar.  Quick bartender service.  3 TVs at every angle at the bar.  Quality Prices.  QUALITY DAY.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I don't frequent the Marina so I was intrigued by this "Non-Marina" bar. I doubt it really succeeds entirely in its mission due to its location but I have to admit on a thursday night, it seemed like one pretty cool dive bar.

Two Pool Tables with "Rules" to ensure that people wait in line and play fairly...not to mention the bartenders are pretty good about making sure no one lays down on the pool tables. Yes, it did happen a number of times while I was there.

Bartenders were quick with good services and polite. I could see myself hanging out here just to de-compress and chill. Even some of the clientele seemed friendly and engaged. Granted we were probably the most fun and craziest group they had seen inawhile but I appreciate friendliness.

I remember decent drinks and not breaking the bank. Definitely worth a gander
author: Mike T.

description:
I love the Shoe, but I don't buy the whole "non-Marina bar bar" idea. Same crowd, just slightly more dressed down.

fun? yup. Good, stiff drinks? yup. but we have to fess up and admit it's a "marina-bar". (not that there's anything wrong with that)
author: James F.

description:
The Horseshoe is the "non-Marina Marina bar." The Horseshoe has been full of "Marina" people every time I've been, but it's not as bad as some places like Bar None. Plus, there's pool in the back and room to have a conversation without feeling overly crowded. 

If I'm in the Marina, I'll most likely opt for the Horseshoe, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here otherwise.
author: Jessica C.

description: Great place to grab a casual drink if you are in the neighborhood.  Also good for pre-drinking if you are going to one of the 'livelier' areas nearby.  Many nights you will wish you just stayed here, and you can always come back.  Good times.
author: Jonas C.

description:
Love it.... for the beer, the staff and the friends!
Hate it.... for too many dates with 'Stella' and the hangovers afterwards!
author: Dazza M.

description:
Now THIS is my kind of bar. Coming from the East coast, I'm used to hole-in-the-wall pubs and dives. It's slightly dark, a little rough-around-the-edges dingy, and it makes me feel like I'm home here! They always have my New England teams on and the beer is on the good and cheap. I can also find a few fellow Chowdaheads to converse with. 

The bartenders there are definitely friendly and they know their drinks. My favorite bah-tender is Aaron. He's a Yankees fan, but a good sport and we definitely get some kicks poking fun at each other. It's nice that the owner comes, dressed down, and hangs out with the patrons too. All in all, it's a great place to kick back at the end of the day, hang out with friends, or possibly make some new ones.
author: Cris M.

description: A nice little dive bar tucked away in the Marina. Great music selection, a good selection of some drinks, nice and strong. TVs galore, for some sports, and a couple of pool tables in the back. A nice place to relax, and soak in the evening with some friends...
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Great local PUB!!!

I prefer the after 5pm before 11pm crowd...it can be a little "Marina-ish" after 11pm.

Arron and Brooke, you ROCK!
(oh yeah get some hand chalk for the pool table)
author: Robert D.

description:
It's difficult to characterize this bar - it's far too casual to be a trendy hangout joint of ladies fully decked out in stiletto pumps, dressed to the nines and all blinged out, yet the Marina location and the crowd, albeit casually dressed, are just too upscale-y to be a dive bar.   

Case in point, I almost walked right into a sleeping golden retriever as I entered the bar (the fur color blended in with the wooden floor).  After recovering from the mini-shock, I looked around and saw, as I tried to find my group of friends, a narrow bar area, plasma TV and *surprise surprise* pool table in the back.  

Unlike any other bars in the Marina, in Horseshoe Tavern there is no need to fight your way into the bar, stepping into other people's feet, arms flailing trying to get the bartender's attention so that he can go fetch you an ice-cold glass of Blue Moon (on tap!).  No shouting necessary either.  At least not on a Thursday night.  

Pathetic Marina parking situation is probably what would keep me from visiting this place more often.
author: Ange L.

description: Yeah for Horseshoe! Cheap drinks, cool bar mistress, TV tuned to the game, pool table... in the Marina?? Yes. I love hitting up this place before and after softball night to wind up/wind down. Kudos to Horseshoe for bucking the Marina trend AND being a fun place to chill with friends.
author: Sean N.

description:
you can't use a sharpie to write "#6" on the freaking #10 ball and call it a solid! buy a goddamn new ball, cheap-asses!!!

***this place smells like burning (Ralph Wiggam)
author: Valerie N.

description:
[overdue overdue, but check my next 2 reviews if you feel like twidling your thumbs]...

***
I've noticed that every weekend i pass by, this place is ALWAYS packed. yea, even on thursdays, more so on Th, then F...

TOO packed to say the very least. Made a quick stop and left rather quickly. 

I swear, this place is THE NON MARINA BAR EVER in the MARINA district. 

Can I say, "DAMN, talk about a friggin cockfest... a true sausage fest" 

Is this a typical Marina scene to see a 10-1 ratio of men to women? I should be lucky to say that I'm a female, but it was to the point of making me grossed out. 

2 pool tables in the back, it's a fun localbar, but it can get pretty packed

Overall, kick back joint with great drinks. Honestly, it's not a place for us ladies to really look for cute men, more of a local bar where you wanna come on a weekday and catch a game. Yes guys, girls DO watch games too... 

Basically, this is what a typical sports bar/local bar feels like. 

Grabbing a drink, chatting with a bud, and enjoying a game or two. 

Can I also mention how gross the bathroom was? Man, clean up, will ya? Nasty TP everywhere, eek~!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Favourite place in SF - great for daytime drinking.  Gary the bartender is a gem!  Whenever I'm in SF, my friends and I always spend an afternoon belly up to the bar - chatting & drinking.
author: Jenni T.

description: I play in a softball league that is sponsored by the Horseshoe.  No frills, friendly service.  Many beers on tap.  There is always a sporting event on one of the screens. I will be back with my softball team.
author: Tony L.

description: Great bar, great staff, great owner!  I'm not a regular but the few times when I've gone to the Horseshoe Tavern, I've been greeted by either the owner himself or one of his great regular bartenders.  Everyone working there seems to genuinely be happy working there - what a nice feeling to get in any bar or restaurant!
author: Melissa D.

description: Great relaxing bar to sit while your wife shops. Gerry makes a hell of a bloody mary and the clientele are friendly
author: Phil L.

description: Funny they claim to be the un-marina marina bar, because it is all the worst parts about the people who aspire to someday be a Marina yuppie who hang out at Matrix. The backwards baseball caps, baggy jeans, frat boy date-rape mentality are all prevalent at this annoying bar, which reminds me of the trite dives in Isla Vista where I went to college moons ago. The bartenders are forgettable, not there fault, they have to break up a fight or clean up jock vomit so much it's hard to retain friendly focus. So if you crave the obnoxious, crowded dens of your 19 year old fake ID college years, this might be great place to relive those senseless memories, start a fight, and maybe slip a girl a roofie, why my buddy who lives out here likes this place is beyond me, it gets more than one star because they do put up with drunken aforementioned buddy, who on reflection, maybe shouldn't be my buddy!!
author: Steve l.

description: Nothing personal against the Horseshoe, but I have worked in the Marina for five years and still don't ever go here. Basically non-descript Marina bar, and with The Marina Lounge and it's bartender charm, The Tipsy Pig and it's stiff drinks, and The Balboa and it's history all within a short walk it's hard for me to love this bar. I've had few shots here, but most people I know who live in the Marina drink elsewhere. Still, it always seems relatively busy, and I bet for the regulars it provides a nice haven from the horrors of daily living, and to that I tip my hat, may we all have a haven.
author: brant f.

description: Great "Non-Marina" bar in the Marina!  Meredith, the witty barmaid, is awesome... she's won funniest bartender for, like, ever.  They stock the bar with local brews and the most recent Playboys, which make for interesting conversation pieces.  Especially when Meredith cuts holes in  the mouths and crotches of the chicks and talks from them!  Eff'n hilarious!  Down-home peeps and good drinks to give you just the buzz you need to deal with the Chestnut crowd... the only way to cope!
author: Tara G.

description: Day-drinking here is the best.  Have a chat with Meredith - be ready for some zingers!  She is full of vim and vigor.
author: Pamela D.

description: This is by far the best Marina bar, because it's the only non-Marina bar there.  I had a blast watching several of the World Cup games there this summer.  The Shoe brings in people that are open and friendly and not your snobby Marina types.  I have made several friends there and have gotten to know SF's best bartender in Meridith.  The Shoe also serves Boonville Beer (my home town) on tap, so I could never find a better place to have a better beer in all of SF!  Thanks to The Shoe!
author: Michael N.

description: Not a bad place, if you're stuck in the Marina.  It's right on the cusp of being a little too much on some occasions.  The earlier in the day you can go, the better.
author: John G.

description: This is a nice place to come for a drink in an otherwise tricky area. Friendly staff with some quality pool tables in the back. I am also extremely grateful to the bar staff for not kicking us out for my buddy's drunken antics. Good people.
author: Sven S.

description: I like the horseshoe.  Not really sure why.  As laid back of an atmosphere as you can get, generally friendly bartenders, and beer.  Not much else going on there, but great place to go have a cold beverage with a friend.  I like it.  I like it a lot.
author: Brad K.

description: small bar. gets crowded especially right in the front area by the entrance. there is actually a lot of space towards the back of the bar where the pool table is but everyone seems to set up shop right at the front. *shrug* lots of good looking people. i'd come back if i was in the area.
author: Linda N.

description:
i came here once after a playoff victory with my softball team at moscone. there we were, all ten of us, sweaty and dirty and still in our unis, drinking beers, celebrating.

and in came five mannequins who saw us, stopped, and then turned around and walked right out.

quite possibly, it was the best time i ever had in the marina.
author: Steve T.

description: Ahaha, ye old Horseshoe.  Somehow, for better or worse, I always end up at this place when I'm in the Marina. What can I say? It's nice to be a girl and get hooked up with drinks. It's about as divey as the Marina gets (so, not divey at all) and has a much more laid back vibe.  Drinks are always poured heavy handed and solid jams are always on the juke box.  I like this place because I have fun here no matter if it's empty or jam packed, although my level of inebriation may play a roll. Give it a shot and if you don't like it, you can always head up to some bar on Union.
author: Kelley B.

description: Great local bar. Sarah and Aaron are the best bartenders in town. Watch out for crowds on weekends. And watch out - they take credit cards now! Uh oh! No froufrou drinks, folks - this place is the real thing. Jukebox, pool table, liars' dice and lots of drinks...gots to love the hooks under the bar for purses and coats...
author: Sarah R.

description: Yep, the only place on this side of town worth going. Like many places, I'm not a big fan of the weekend night crowds, but people should come to see Meredith during the daytimes. She's fucking great, a real classic in San Francisco. I think she works Tuesday through Saturdays.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Yes, they bill themselves as "the non-Marina Marina bar" and while I appreciate them ripping on their own 'hood, there seems to be no great dearth of bros and deeche (plural of "douche") at this bar.  

There are big TVs on the walls for sports (two in the area near the bar, one maybe two in the pool room area) and a pool table in the back, and decent beers on tap, but this bar is essentially a big "meh."  I'll condescend to enter after a softball game when we get stuck playing at Moscone Field (softball being one of the only reasons nowadays my ass will go down to the Marina) because it is close and less terrible than other places nearby, but it's nothing worth going out of your way for.  The only thing distinguishing this bar is that it's in the Marina and a BAR-bar, when most of of the other places are swanky swank.  But it's too clean to feel like a fun dive, and the beer isn't even that cheap.  It would be just like any other bar on 99 in Washington or on one of the many interchangeable main streets in the South Bay, except at least in those bars it's fun because you expect to be bored and a little depressed lending to its air of authenticity.  The Horseshoe is all the boringness without the authenticity.

Points for being an okay bar in one of my least favorite parts of town, and the bartenders are nice, if a bit leery-eyed.

But it would be more accurate to just bill themselves as "A slightly less douchey Marina bar."
author: Ashley B.

description:
I love the Horseshoe! Owner is cool, bartenders are awesome, drinks are priced great. Service is smokin!! 

I had such a great time I forgot I was there because my date earlier was such a neurotic pain in ass freak and I needed  a couple fernets in me as I was deleting her number. 

So glad I stopped in here. I will be back!
author: Patrick C.

description:
i love horseshoe.  divey but not gross, on chestnut but not a marina bar.  the bartendresses (Sarah and Rahel) are fun to talk to and quite good at their craft!!  
Pool tables in the back; jukebox with good tunes...  what else do you need...
author: Alison R.

description: Best bar in the MARINA. Great customer service, meaning: talkative, entertaining bartenders who will tend to you whether or not they see your glass is half empty or half full.
author: c g.

description: Hands down best Bar in the Marina!!!  Ask for Gary and tell him you want a chartreuse Shot.
author: J M B.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Marina!! The bartenders are all super nice, but Aaron is my favorite. It is the perfect place for a fun night out during the week. The atmoshpere is very relaxed and the crowd is always really friendly.
author: Alexia M.

description: They have Golden Tee, Stella Artois, and lots of dice for playing Portugese or Liars.  Good fun.
author: Lauren S.

description: pool table in back and fairly cheap drinks.  4-5 pretty good size TVs for casual sports viewing.  what more could you ask for?  well, maybe a few less marina d-bags, but this place is a great dive to start your trek down chestnut.
author: dan a.

description: Cool place, nice mixed crowd, very hospitable bartenders.  Even though there were very few Pats fans, still a cool place to watch the Superbowl.
author: Todd K.

description: Captures that dive bar feel while having plenty of customers.
author: Joel M.

description: Casual neighborhood bar with friendly bartenders.  I give it 4 stars for daytime drinking sessions and 3 stars for nighttime drinking.  Personally I thought the drinks were a little on the weak side but...prices are fair.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: Ahhh.....so THIS is where the Marina folks come to slum it. I guess this is the Marina version of a divebar. I like it. Cute lil place. The bartender was really nice. For a Monday night, this place was pretty full.  I'm NOT a divebar kinda chick, but I'd still come back here with friends. It's got a comfy, cozy kinda feel to it. Definitely more dudes than chicks, but no one bothers ya. That adds an extra star from me!
author: Ann T.

description: I give 3 stars when it's my first time going and the place is just a place.  We sat at the bar, we had beer.  Apparently this is the alcoholics place to go in the marina, as my cousin, a marina resident of 20+ years, says.
author: Lindsay T.

description: This place was not like all these other marina bars, which was pretty cool.  There were good beers on tap which made me pretty happy and it was pretty full on Saturday afternoon.  Just went there for one drink but it was pretty laid back and chill.
author: Cara D.

description: san francisco meets a casual college rec room....tall drinks...various beers on tap & bottles...pool tables.....safe place to just sip a beer...chat...horseshoe is in the heart of the marina....yet...fairly "asian friendly"....
author: Hen A.

description: I love the Horseshoe.   It's an oasis in the vast desert of yuppiedom that is the Marina.  If I'm forced to spend a night in the Marina, this is where I head.  Good tunes on the jukebox, pool tables, dice, good bartenders and an unpretentious crowd.
author: Andrew E.

description: The jukebox, pool table, and friendly, no-frills crowd make the 'Shoe a great place to grab a few beers after weeknight softball games at Moscone Field.
author: Katie C.

description:
Ok they have possibly one of the most recognizable fricken slogans in all of San Francisco. The "non Marina-Marina bar" huh? I bet you could ask that as a trivia question in almost any other bar in SF and someone would know the answer. Yet the rest of their ads usually have some dumb statement that's straight Marina Boyesque so I can't tell you whether they're being cheeky or being assholes. It's kind of like how they sell shirts and pairs of choners for ten bucks (look above the bar). 

I've only been here a handful of times and I can tell you that have never set foot in there after nightfall. The looming threat of collars turned up, striped/pastel shirts keeps me a way. Even in the afternoon is unavoidable (hey, here's a fashion tip for everyone: if you are male and under 5'5", a salmon Ralph Lauren polo shirt with its collar up is not a good look for you--it's not a good look for anybody). Last time I was here, John H. pointed out the chew drain along the bar which makes me believe that this bar was here before the Marina (as adjective) was. The divey feel is not too shabby. There are a few standard distractions (TVs, pool table, jukebox) and the casual mix of locals, tourtists and seniors during the afternoon is nice as are bartenders. 2 beers will run you out about ten bucks or so, which is a refreshing change in this part of town. Still I shudder at the thought of this place on weekends.
author: Veronica G.

description: The "shoe" is the best dive bar I've found, and certainly the only "non marina" bar in the marina.  Perfect place to play pool or just get wasted in the afternoon.  The owner and staff are really awesome.  The only drawback is that there are so many people that love the "shoe" the crowd is pretty much always the same.
author: Ann Marie w.

description: Good fun for the Marina, not a stuffy crowd, nice bartenders, 2 pool tables, GIANT Big screen TV for your Monday night game. They allow food from the many restaurants around in the bar, so you can get your grub on and your drink on! Is kindof lame when its busy, but great when its not.
author: Rachel L.

description: How could you not like this place.  Simple formula, get the drinks to the customers fast, with no frills.  It works.  The drinks are not too expensive and the service is fast.  They have a pool table in the back for those longer stays.  One bit of advice, don't try to order anything too fancy, because the place is usually busy, and they won't want to make any of those blended drinks when they have 30 people waiting to order bottles of beer.
author: Robert R.

description: Very basic bar, old school San francisco style, nothing fancy, refuses to stock an upscale promo liquor or blend in with the perceived pretentions of the neighborhood.  Bartenders are lifers, so are the customers.  Industry people getting off work and regular folks who don't like heavy Marina scene.
author: Gil S.

description: This bar is for drinkers only - put your cash on the bar and watch it dwindle slowly.  When you get hungry drop by next door to Los Hermanos and get a sloppy burrito
author: Max C.

description: This is the "dive bar" of the Marina??  That's like an oxymoron.  It's an okay bar.  Don't have anything too good or too bad to say about it.
author: Angela S.

description: 4th of July after show hit Horseshoe with a group of girls. I think we made up about 40% of the women there, and there were about 5 of us! I liked it -- sports bar feel with sticky smelly floor and people spilling drinks down your arm which almost seems like a pick-up line in there. May be more tame during normal weeknights, suspect weekends are the same. One of the less "see and be seen" bars in the area which is refreshing.
author: Mel H.

description: Keeps a neighborhood full of bs grounded.  Dark, damp, often packed, with great bartenders and pool tables.  Has all the right things to be an oasis away from your favorite local dive.
author: JP Z.

description: dive bar extrodinaire! we came here after being annoyed by all the marina yuppies and former frat boys telling us we didn't belong in the marina. Fun,  very mixed crowd, pool table in the back, strong strong drinks, and other video games along the walls. Nice bar staff, and I would love to end my night here again.
author: Sarah C.

description: This one is an easy five stars for me!! It's right down the street form me.........an easy drunk walk home. The bartenders are all really nice. This is also a place with no attitude ......and it's in the Marina.....kinda hard to believe. Also a good place to watch a game.........has pools tables........and golden tee for my fellow golf junkies!
author: tom h.

description: I love the Horseshoe - definitely a mellow Marina bar that is almost always filled with non-pretentious friendly people.  One of the coolest things about this bar is that they sell Horseshoe branded thong panties.  If you're tired of buying girls drinks and want to kick things up a notch - I suggest buying her a pair.  Worked well for me - she was wearing them before the night was over...
author: Brian R.

description: Meredith is fantastic. I think she has been ranked funniest bartender in San Francisco four years running by the Bay Guardian readers, until she reached emeritus status. A well deserved award. She is hysterical and you will always have a good time while she is there. The bar is great and you will have a good time.
author: Kevin U.

description: First of all this place gets 5 stars for being a regular bar in a crazy place called the Marina. The staff are cool and it's got a good layout with some pool tables and other niceties. I have to give the edge to Marina Bar because it's homier and the bartenders really do know your name. The crowd's chill and never gets to randy at Horseshow and that's a plus if you know anything about the Marina...
author: Raul L.

description: Undecided on what to drink one night, i stumble into THE HORSESHOE with a friend from out of town.  I sit at the bar, confused and quiet (jack and coke? rum and coke? but what kind of rum?  or maybe they only have pepsi? Shoot what if they have wine? Maybe i should just have a shot of whiskey.) My friend orders, and im still sitting there.  The bartender comes to me and basically digs into my brain to try to figure out what i MIGHT like.  He strongly suggest a nice tall glass of something called Blue Moon with an orange slice.  After a sip, i begin to really like this kid. LOL.  He totally took the time to get me something id enjoy, and so i showed my appreciation by ordering about five more!!  The bartender is pretty funny, resembles Elmer Fudd a little bit...hence my urge to hug him!  The crowd was fun and we hit it off with a few people there.  Pretty interesting place.  Bathrooms needed a little work but hey...its a dive bar!  And a lovely one at that!  I will be back!
author: Catie J.

description:
The bartenders are OK
The drinks are Ok
The atmosphere is OK
But the fact that they bash the Marina in their slogan is ridiculous.  The Marina is a great place to live.  It is safe and offers everything a great neighborhood should.  I have lived here for 17 years.  I do not appreciate the neighborhood bashing, especially by a business that capitalizes on the fact that it is in a neighborhood bar.
author: Allan B.

description: geez - you Marina haters ought not ever go to any Marina bar, regardless of their slogan.  I wear my hat facing forward... for a drinking team with a softball problem... we play 1 hour of softball 3 blocks away and spend 2+ hours drinking here.  "Drinks cold and fast"... that's the best description I've read of the place.  Aaron gets to know you after your 2nd or 3rd time in and then they're even colder and faster.  You go here because your friends are here, sports are on the tube, and the Bartenders are cool... and if some guy with a backwards white cap walks in after he's puked and gotten kicked out of Bar None on Union street... he's usually only there for 20 minutes, so don't spend your life focusing on him and you might enjoy the Shoe.  Amazing how judgemental the non-Marina Marina people are - what are  you doing in the Marina if you hate it so much?
author: Rob R.

description: This place has huge tvs and pool tables! Usually a pretty good crowd and the bartenders are really nice. The only thing is the lack of specials and their drinks are a bit too pricey for the establishment. You're in a sports bar paying upscale club prices, that was my turn off.
author: Olga P.

description: Love, love. love The Shoe. Fun little dive bar in a neighborhood where those are hard to come by! Great atmosphere, great people and the beer somehow always tastes better here.  It is truly a happy place for sports fans and alcoholics...
author: Sara M.

description:
This place is awesome.  Bartenders are all really cool and friendly.  This was the first bar I frequented when I moved to San Francisco from NY and 6 years later it is still my local spot with many familiar faces.  

It has the DirectTV football ticket so a good place to watch games on Sunday if you are looking for something kind of low key.  Thurs, Friday, Saturday can be really packed, so make sure you are in the right mood.
author: Gregg G.

description: It's a bar.  Yes it's in the marina which means anytime after 11 on Thur-Sat there are going to be lots of people standing around that you'd like to strangle.  Rest of the week though it's just a bar.  Grab me a Guinness and tell Aaron I said wasup.
author: Alex M.

description: I went their last saturday. The place was full of guys(boos) and very little women. Some wore Santa Claus outfit for the beer crawl that was happening in the city, but it was mostly men and couples.  Yeah the bartender has an sarcastic attitude, but i get my drink fast!
author: Stanley L.

description: I love this place.  It's so casual and fun.  Great atmosphere, great bartenders, and great people.
author: V E.

description: Very ordinary bar.  Although the structure is "divy" the people are not- they are too dressed up to be divy.  But I can't really say anything too bad about this place.
author: Lisa X.

description: my coed flag-football team used to come here a lot after our games and practices. its a tiny little dive bar in the marina... i think its actually the only dive bar in the marina area.(?) its so laid back i used to come in my sweats and cleats and no one cared. they have a pool table, darts and good bartenders. what more could you ask for?
author: Michelle I.

description: Terrible Bar, at least on a Sunday night.  I was kicked out...why?  A man who could hardly stand was sitting at the bar and kept getting served by the bartender.  Sure enough the man dumped a drink on me, in which case i told the bar tender to please cut the man off.  The bartender refused telling me "not to tell him how to do his job".  What an asshole.  Don't waste your time at this bar, especially with asshole bartenders like that.
author: Chris M.

description: ended up here after a long night of drinking to celebrate...well nothing in particular. the bartender was super friendly and catered to the needs of our group of 10, serving up the c-lights like it was nobody's business. it wasnt very crowded, so there was plenty of room to mingle with the few patrons that were there. it seemed like it woudl be a fun place to watch football on the weekends or crash after a soccer game with friends. i will probably head back some day!
author: Jessica B.

description: this is my favorite bar in the neighborhood hands down. not only does it have a full bar but it also has a pool table in the back and a working jukebox. what more can one ask for right? its very low key and each time ive gone ive had no problems finding a seat (go early to avoid the rush) and the bartenders are all very nice. plus it also helps that they are very generous with their drinks. this is a great place to come to start off the night or when you are having a tough day at work and if things get a little out of hand, getting home is less than a block away.
author: georgette y.

description: best place in San Francisco to meet a "non-marina" marina man
author: Sarah N.

description: cool, little dive bar in the marina....crowded though, geez- excuse me, pardon me, sorry about that, excuse me, opps sorry, coming through, tap tap, hi, sorry , excuse me....that's what i said after showing my I.D. and on my way to finding an open spot to order an adult beverage- some cutie pie's in here ladies....excuse me, pardon me.....
author: Ricquel N.

description: this is a real bar in a neighborhood of weird pseudo bar/lounge types. it has a pool table, and I actually met people here. it is a friendly atmosphere with a young crowd who tend to be more laid-back than most marina-ites.
author: Natalie K.

description: Just your friendly neighboorhood bar...good place to grab a drink on a weeknight, shoot some pool and watch a ball game.
author: Roger T.

description: I think this is one of the few bars in the Marina I actually like. The bartenders are nice and the crowd isn't too obnoxious.
author: Annie L.

description: Great dive spot.. seems to avoid the traditional marina plastic. Tough to find a spot to stand on a busy night, though... great place to pre-party.
author: David F.

description: This is always a great place to stop if your roaming around on weekend.  Friendly bartenders and a much more enjoyable crowd then some of the areas other bars.
author: Robert D.

description: what a great spot. great bartenders, they absolutely put the fu in fun. i still refer to this place as the whore shoe because of, well, you get the idea.
author: Jeff B.

description: I went here with some old coworkers. My friend and I had expected to go to a bonfire that night so we weren't expecting to be hit on (we were in sweatpants and shirts).. but god damn was every man there of every race, age, and stereotype there RUTHLESS. And honestly, you have to pay for the pool tables and fight over them with rude men dressed in silk skirts and scarfs (i'm bi so i totally respect the gay/tranny community, but honeslty, it was so ridiculous, I had to yelp about it), the bar itself was great, they were accomidating to everyones issues, but honestly, it was bullshit. I shouldn't have to fight over who gets next round when me and my partner have held it down all night, that's the rule of pool. Cute guys were everywhere, lack of hot women though I have to say, ladies let's change this for the hotties in their soccer cleats. very sports bar chic.. the guiness was pored amazingly, I would go here again, but with a body gaurd and an abundance of hot women.. because It's lame to have to deal with that shit solo when your tryin to have fun.
author: Katie M.
